story:
Short Summary

The Adventures of Monkey King may very well be the greatest book you have never read.  It is an utterly unique epic that provides a rollicking adventure along with deep insight into the Buddhist faith.  

How is it possible that this miscreant Monkey is revered in China and throughout Asia and yet almost completely unknown in America?  With this new translation I hope to change that by making Monkey King's story truly accessible to a western audience.

As Scott Black has written in the book's introduction:  "When we engage Monkey’s story—when we take our turn with it—we too are again born, enlivened, and shaped by his extraordinary adventures, his comic cheekiness, and his cosmic rebellion. Monkey, that is, lives again in—or as—our monkey minds. We give life to him as he gives delightfully heightened form to our cravings and fantasies." 

This project represents the culmination of a journey that began for me more than 30 years ago when I first came across a copy of Monkey's adventures in a bookstore in Taiwan.  Ever since then Monkey King has been working his magic on my mind.  Ten years ago I started on the path of learning to read Chinese so I could eventually tackle my own translation of the book.  Now with this Indiegogo campaign I am finally on the verge of bringing the vision to fruition.   


What We Need & What You Get

To complete preparation and publication of our first edition, we need to raise enough funds to cover the costs of the illustrations, layout & design and printing:

  • We're offering first edition copies of the book for $35.  This first edition will not be available or sold through any channel other than our Indiegogo campaign.  
  • The book is beautifully illustrated by the Brazilian artist Marcelo Zissu and each copy will be signed by me.
  • We need to pre-sell a minimum of 75 copies in order to cover our costs and reach our minimum campaign goal of $2,250.

The Impact

As the translator of this book, not the author, I have no compunction in telling you that it really is utterly unique and one of the greatest books of all time.  If you are at all drawn to Daoism and Buddhism it is essential reading.  And even if you're not yet interested in Eastern spirituality then this is great way to discover what you're missing.

I am a writer, poet and translator.  This will be my third published book.  My last book was published through a successful campaign on Kickstarter, which sold several hundred copies and raised more than $5000; it was a poem which told the true life story of a 90 year old homeless man who lived on the streets of New York City.   

The first chapter of the Monkey King translation was previously published online by Brooklyn Rail and you can read it here to get a better idea of the style of my new translation:   http://intranslation.brooklynrail.org/chinese/the-adventures-of-monkey-king   

You can also read more poetry and extensive selections of my translations of classic Chinese poetry on my personal blog:  http://lampoetry.blogspot.com/

Risks & Challenges

It's hard to break through the noise and clutter.  But I'm convinced that if you give Monkey King a few moments of your precious time you'll discover some wonderful things about your own Monkey Mind.  But only you can overcome whatever resistance you have to picking up a book-length poem about a miscreant monkey -- something that may seem incredibly strange and different from your customary reading.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I greatly appreciate your support in helping me bring Monkey King's story to America.  Whether you buy the book or not won't you please help spread the word?  Please give us a boost on social media.  Remember you can use the sharing tools on Indiegogo to let people know that Sun Wu Kong - the Great Sage and Equal to Heaven - is on his way.   It's time to prepare for some powerful insights into the workings of your Monkey Mind!

story:
A flower for every person who helped make it happen!


WE DID IT!! 

WE RAISED 104% WITH 8 DAYS TO GO! 

...So now what?

and now...

IM STILL WORKING ON THIS PROJECT.

 Its bigger than it looks!

I am moving full steam ahead to raise the money for campaign costs i didn't expect, (including a whopping $400 so far for postage alone)


OUR STRETCH GOALS: 


If we make it to 9000 

this project will officially be ZERO burden on my family for having done it… it would even include some replacement art supplies at the end of it all. 

If we make it to 10,000
I will purchase an $800 publishing package and offer a hardcopy art workbook with high res scans of all 108 mandalas, ink illustrations for colouring, poetry and prompts for provoking more self-healing-expression in your life.

If we make it to 11,000 
will purchase an airbrush and some plywood and paint, and begin producing large scale work for outdoor installation.

If we make it to 12,000… well, Ill throw a Painting Workshop for twenty women GRATIS… and get back to my business planning…

Thats what Ive got right now…

(check out the 'updates' tab above to see a few images and stories about how WE ALL pulled together to make the campaign a success!)

my family is in a tender place with the countdown to my departure being less than a week. 


Sending heart felt loving grateful kindness  to ALL OF YOU !! 


(and PLEASE keep up the sharing- its working!! ) 

XO

C


My Story: 

I am a Metis Artist born and raised in Fort St James BC, in Carrier Territory-Northern BC (Canada) and I am currently living & raising my family (6 children) on a farm on Vancouver Island.


Growing up in an isolated Northern Village, my mixed heritage was a unique blessing and a strange curse…  I witnessed violence occurring in ALL cultures; particularly against women and their children.  I also witnessed Love in ALL cultures, strong and virtuous family connections and most of all, a long-term kind of love that our community had for each other.

I became an active member of our Fireweed Women’s Society when I had children of my own. I dreamed of one day owning and teaching at a womens co-housing facility, and I pursued a BA degree in First Nations Studies, and a minor in Visual Art from Vancouver Island University.

Not long after my graduation my family went into crisis mode. I was left with no options and almost overnight I had become a client at a Womens Safe House, rather than managing one…I was devastated.

 I began an epic Art journey into healing my own heart and mind. Along the way, I met many who were doing the same. I started to study and work with Shiloh Sophia McCloud & the Cosmic Cowgirls Artist Network, and I have been teaching and assisting many others with their own healing work, in person and in workshops.


TODAY I PAINT. I paint in studio, and I paint live for large audiences. My intent is to trigger feelings of self-compassion in the viewer… To help my audience see themselves for the beautiful and loving people that they are, and always were. If I’ve done well, it works like medicine for the Soul.

I ALSO TEACH. It has been my humble honour to put a brush and a set of skills into the hands of beginner women & girl artists. I lead them safely into the depths of their own psyche, and help them produce art that is healing, empowering & truthful for them.

and inspirational for everyone…


The Money part:

$   750 deposit 

$2800 tuition & accommodation

$2200 airfare

$1500 high quality oil paints & oil brushes



  • PS- If I don't make the amount of money by the deadline, and can't go this July, your donation will be placed into a separate rolling fund to attend a future semester with the Vienna Academy of Visionary Art. 

  • PPS- Please note that these quotes are general, and meant to include unforeseen fees. A full pdf of expenses will become available for significant contributors via my subscriber list at crystal charlotte.com

  • PPPS- If this campaign generates more than is asked for, all remaining funds will be invested into launching my art business.


The Impact

  • We will paint 7hrs a day, 6 days per week. To me, this is heaven, but it's also essential to the development of my own work.
  • Learning from these master painters is going to develop my Art, and the Art of those whom I teach.
  • Several of my returning painting students are ready for me to begin offering advanced painting skills; and i see this trip as a mission to retrieve those skills.
  • Investments in an artist development become  visible in each progressive painting.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?...that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Use the links on this page to get the word out, and to make it easy to find! use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Greetings and Introduction

My name is Dallas.  I began going to Burning Man in 2007 having no idea what it was nor knowing anyone who had ever been except one person, Philip Longfellow.  This friend told me it would change my life, and it did, as a result of his insistence that I come to this thing in the desert.  

I've learned a new way of being in the world by applying the promulgated Ten Principles and by camping and collaborating with other creative hearts and minds in Black Rock City and beyond.  You all continue to inspire, encourage and support the individual and collective self expressions of our vast and wide community.  

This project, and my first foray into facilitating an participatory art experience, happened solely because of Burning Man and specifically due to support from the Regional Network.

I give you Gratitude!  

How did this start?

The New York City burner founded FIGMENT was the impetus for this project with their "What will you bring?" call for art and participation.  Their radically inclusive ask opened me to creating an interactive experience with the use of mirrors and written affirmations , which I called the 'AffirMirroR'.  I used all found objects including two large plexiglass mirrors, framing wood, adornments and fabric retrieved from the streets and dumpsters of Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan. 

(photo of the AffirMirroR by Eraj Asadi)

What is a 'Reflectahedron'?

In spring 2014, the Las Vegas Burning Man regional gathering, The Forgotten City, put out a their call for art.  I responded with a concept for a new version of the "AffirMirroR" that would be made from highly polished reflective stainless steel in the form of a tetrahedron.  This mirrored pyramid, nicknamed the 'myrrormid', is a reflective polyhedron, which I dub, a reflectahedron.  


A reflectahedron is a mirrored stainless steel polyhedron designed as a transformative tool for reflection, perspective and illumination. Participants interact by writing affirmations, positive statements, dreams, wishes, compassionate commands, states of being, or other self expressions.

This first reflectahedron, a regular (equilateral) tetrahedron, is the first of the Platonic Solids. The long term vision of this project is to build reflectahedrons of all the platonic solids.  

From Wikipedia:  [Many] "have studied the mathematical beauty and symmetry of the Platonic solids for thousands of years. They are named for the ancient Greek philosopherPlato who theorized in his dialogue, the Timaeus, that the classical elements were made of these regular solids.[1]"



After bringing the reflectahedron to Las Vegas thanks to a grant from The Forgotten City, it has appeared at FIGMENT San Diego and various burner events and public beach parks in the Los Angeles area.  Everyone who interacts with the reflectahedron seems to have a very positive experience.



Why Am I Doing This?

I feel that sharing concepts of positive thinking, affirmations, the power of pyramids and sacred geometry along with mirrors and reflectivity can help enable self empowerment and shift the collective consciousness in the direction of truth, beauty, compassion and Love.   

Plus, it's a beautiful object and quite visually compelling.   I really enjoy setting it up and seeing how people interact.




What's Next?

I want to bring this to more people and places.  

How?  On wheels!   

The next phase of this project is building a personal art transport device by attaching it to a motorized wheelchair base.    This will allow an individual Reflectahedron sculpture, along with a docent rider, to be easily transported to more places and participants at Burning man or other festival, event or public space.  

If more than the goal is raised I'd like to make additional "myrrormids", because more triangular face pieces will allow me to either configure a larger scale version, or reconfigure the panels to create an octahedron or dodecahedron.  

The larger scale would require building two more of the current sized model, then constructing a steel frame rigging method to combine all of the panels into one larger sculpture, with an opening indicated be the red lines. allowing people to get inside for shade or more writing (it is mirrored inside as well, although not as highly polished).


This configuration allows me to setup individual myrrormid reflectahedrons in separate locations.  Then, later they can be combined together to be installed into a larger reflective "effigy" object, that would be read and perhaps wiped clean in a "burn" like activity.  

What's Needed?

For the mobile art transport system:

- One used motorized wheelchair and and materials for the base (~ $750)

For each additional myrrormid reflectahedron:

- 1 sheet of #8 polished stainless steel cut and bent to design spec (~$600)

BONUS: Trailer / Ramp for transporting the wheelchair with my van. (~ $500)

If the goal is not met, collected funds will be used to support the current Reflectahedron art’s presentation, in way of markers, windex, a buffer and compound to polish the steel, and fuel to transport the Reflection to events.  

How can you help and what will you get?

* Please share this campaign link on you social networks  

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/reflectahedron

* Follow the instagram 

http://instagram.com/reflectahedron

* Friend the Facebook 

http://instagram.com/reflectahedronart

* Donate materials (do you happen to have a spare wheelchair?)

For perks,  besides what I can personally offer, I am also reaching out to others who have tetrahedron or platonic solid related art to ask them if they'd like to participate.   I have found some folks already that are excited to be involved.  

Keep an eye on updates for new perks as I make contact with more artists.

Here's the first  featured guest perk from Etsy user RawElementsJewelry



And a sample image of the T-Shirt


NOTE:  MORE PERKS TO COME (please check back often to see what's new and/or suggest something)

Also, you don't have to give anything to have an experience with the Reflectahedron.  It's already going to be at Burning Man 2014, and if possible, will be mobile this year (provided I can obtain funds in advance of your contributions to make it happen before I arrive).  

Come find me at The Sunset Trip village at 8:00 & Esplanade in the Dirty Beetles camp and let's play with the reflectahedron.   

Thank you so much!     

Burning Love,
Dallas

story:
Summary

The U.S. voted, and it's sick of me! So it got some crazy idea to have an artist residency in Canada offer me a place to stay for a week this August. Or is that the conspiracy theorist in me talking? Actual summary: I have been offered a place at a residency in Wolfville, Nova Scotia this summer, but it is going to take some extra funding to get me there.

  • As many of you know, I am a painter based out of Portland Oregon. While I love the city, my work is fueled by time I spend away from my home-studio. Residencies have proved valuable to pushing my exploration and vision.
  • This program, called Biophilia, is open to a small group of artists who have an affinity to scientific processes and the natural world. Aside from painting and ideation time, the program includes lectures on stars, mushroom foraging, microscope time, and, yes, long walks on the beach --with other artists, writers, and performers who look toward the natural world for inspiration. 
  • This is a place where I belong! All of the funding in this campaign goes towards attending the residency, as outlined below. 

What I Need and Why

I have enjoyed two U.S. residencies in the past two years (Brush Creek Ranch in Wyoming, the Grünewld Guild in Washington State) which were funded by the institution, grants, and volunteer hours. This residency requires payment from me to attend, and I am not amidst a grant cycle in Oregon where a grant is an option this time around. Here is what I need to make it happen:

  • $1000 - the residency fee, which covers room, board, transportation, space to work, lectures and tours throughout.
  • $1000 - travel to and from Nova Scotia as well as baggage fees, shipment of materials and finished products.
  • In this campaign, every dollar counts: It is not "all or nothing ." I will be working to supplement what is not raised here. 

Many Thanks

  • I am offering both prints and original paintings as a trade for your funding -- check out the "perks" on this page for information, and the "gallery" section for examples.
  • I will be exploring systems and patterns in the natural environment as well as mankind's relationship to them, but the residency is meant also to foster collaboration and networking.  I am looking forward to the time, space, and people who will make this a fulfilling journey for me.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always help by simply sharing my campaign! I already know I have lots of support out there. I have two short months before the residency starts. Many thanks again! -Sarah

This residency requires payment from me to attend, and I am not amidst a grant cycle in Oregon where a grant is an option this time around. Here is what I need to make it happen:
$1000 - the residency fee, which covers room, board, transportation, space to work, lectures and tours throughout.
$1000 - travel to and from Nova Scotia as well as baggage fees, shipment of materials and finished products.
In this campaign, every dollar counts: It is not "all or nothing ." I will be working to supplement what is not raised here. 
Many Thanks
I am offering both prints and original paintings as a trade for your funding -- check out the "perks" on this page for information, and the "gallery" section for examples.
I will be exploring systems and patterns in the natural environment as well as mankind's relationship to them, but the residency is meant also to foster collaboration and networking.  I am looking forward to the time, space, and people who will make this a fulfilling journey for me.
Other Ways You Can HelpYou can always help by simply sharing my campaign! I already know I have lots of support out there. I have two short months before the residency starts. Many thanks again! -Sarah

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am an artist and student studying at the Massachusetts College of Art and Design. My book, Hiccup, is a story that I have been working on for the past few years. Those who know me know that I hiccup every day, and have for the past five years. This story is based on a specific instance when my hiccups caused a teacher to kick me out of class. 

This underwater version of the tale uses the exact quotes from my teacher, personified into a puffer fish. Blaine, A hermit crab, goes on a journey to cure his hiccups and meets many new friends as they suggest increasingly outlandish solutions.

 In the end, the Hermit crab learns that people have different views on what should actually be considered a "problem" and that it is not always something you have to change in yourself. 

The book was made using a variety of materials, and everything was hand produced. The mediums used include ink, watercolor, guache, silkscreen and dying papers with bubbles.

For larger images of the illustrations and excerpts from the story please check out the image gallery!

What We Need & What You Get

These funds will go to the following:

  • Printing the book
  • Buying an ISBN number 
  • Shipping Costs
  • indiegogo and processing fees
What you get in return:
The book and a variety of hand made bonuses! 

Examples of handmade bookmarks and thank you cards!
I will be printing through ingramspark, so the book will continue to be available printed on demand through amazon. 
What if I do not meet the full goal? Don't worry! I will still be able to print and ship as many books as are requested! 

The Impact

This is a personal project that I have been working on for the past few years. While the story is about curing hiccups, the message is significantly larger than this. It was written as I was struggling with coming out as pansexual to my very conservative family, and finally understood the fact that my sexuality is not a problem or something that I should try to change. 

I hope that this book teaches children at a young age that you do not need to change yourself to accommodate everyone. Not every problem we face in life has a clear-cut solution, and the impact of having strong relationships with people who care for you is the most beneficial in facing these struggles.  

    Risks & Challenges

    The challenges in this project are the time it takes to hand produce the personal rewards and ship each of them. To overcome this, I spent the summer creating as much of the perks as I could in anticipation for the campaign. I also have a team of volunteers ready to help me ship everything out!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help spread the word about this project! Share with all your friends.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Meg Harris and I am a dreamer, a baker, and a puppeteer who manifests dreams into reality. I find inspiration in the oddities of life; the dead of night, the moment between sleep and wake, daydreams, nightmares, unexplained happenings, the unseen, and the untapped human curiosity. Giving life to inanimate objects is my goal as a visual artist, the medium used may vary but the underlying objective stays the same.
 I have been working on some version of Puppets and Pastries for the past few years and will continue to evolve this into a business every free moment that I have. I am a passionate, fastidious, imaginative artist/baker with a midwestern work ethic who is well connected and resourceful. 
This campaign is to make Puppets and Pastries into a mobile space that can travel, containing a certified kitchen, and also a pop up puppet stage.
I am creating a multi-sensory experience that blurs the line between strange and irresistible. The baked goods will be made from scratch using only local, organic ingredients, and will be shaped/decorated as creatures, each with a story of their own. Puppet shows, workshops, music and a sensory environment will accompany the pastries, making an experience both playful and efficient. I am researching similar models of bakeries and spaces with eclectic or bizarre themes and noting how entertainment is involved and utilized.  I expect a wide range of interest in this multi-faceted business model that I am forming. 

Puppets and Pastries is my life dream and you can be a part of this experience. We as a community could use more laughter, imagination and cake, of course, and I am excited to bring that to all of you.

What We Need & What You Get

I am in need of $10,000 to start up this mobile space, which entails buying a used RV or astrovan type vehicle, gutting it and building within it a wondrous bakery/puppet theatre space where kids of all ages can enjoy treats of many kinds. These donations will purchase not only the vehicle, the equipment updates inside, but also supplies to create a pop up puppet stage outside attached to the side of the vehicle. Also some technical things such as business/food cart lisenses and certification fees so it can be a legit business in Oregon.  Not only this, but if funding is ample, hand cast cake molds, cake boxes and baking supplies will be needed. 

If funding doesn't reach this goal, I still appreciate any help i can get. I will purchase the vehicle and fix it up at the very least. I have applied for various grants to cover some costs also, for puppet workshop supplies, puppet show creation materials and also marketing materials. My goal is to get Puppets and Pastries mobile up and running for summer/fall of 2017.

You will also receive fun hand made gifts when you contribute- some of which will be sent out in time for the winter holidays. See the Perks page for more info on those.

The Impact

Puppets and Pastries is not only a puppet theatre and pastry shop, but it is a community oriented art project. I have been, and will continue to teach puppet making workshops to kids at low costs so all can attend. I work with local community events and companies to bring laughter and joy to a wide range of people and places. 

My audience ranges from children to adults who contain a sense of wonder and curiosity about the world and who enjoy the sweeter things in life. I desire for Puppets and Pastries to become a community space for the expression of imagination and strangeness. 
Puppets and Pastries is not solely a for profit space, it will be a community based location where the audience/patron will be thought of and treated as part of the family. We will work together in a give and take in order to change perceptions of a consumerist business model. I need the company to be sustainable but am more interested in sharing a space with the local people and becoming part of each others lives in a positive creative manner. 
 I truly believe that anything is still possible in this world and that a new world is just as likely as an old one. 

Risks & Challenges

I am aware of the challenges of starting a small business in such hard financial times, but I am a very versatile and intelligent person who wont let things get out of hand. I also believe in taking risks in life in order to truly live. Nothing is a failure, it is just a new perception on an experience. We can learn from everything. As you will see, I will put my all into Puppets and Pastries and it will be a success, one way or another. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help...

Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign, share the video, tag any photos you may have, and word of mouth is stronger than you think!

Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools.

I appreciate all of you reading this and supporting me in what ever way you can. Thank you from the depths of my soul. 

Meg Harris

story:
Natasha Lisitsa and Daniel Schultz here!  We are the wife + husband team behind Waterlily Pond, an art studio in San Francisco, California.

Our Experience:  We have years of experience in large-scale installation art for special events, museum openings, and are well-known internationally in the floral design community for our larger-than-life work and dynamic stage presentations. Our work is a unique combination of sculpture, floral design, and architectural design.

View time lapse videos of our Large Scale Floral Art installations at the de Young Museum:  Flornado and Elemental. 

   

Moving Forward: Our ambition is to design permanent sculptures for public spaces and architectural environments.  For the first time, we are taking on an outdoor public art project, and are excited to share our vision with the city.

The Proposal:  An art-minded building owner has offered us the opportunity to design and install a temporary piece on a prominent building façade in the Hayes Valley neighborhood of San Francisco. 

Below is a photo of the building with a previous piece, "The Flag Building"

The Design: A stylish, geometric, and dynamic façade.  A kinetic composition of clean architectural and organic materials alludes to the unique energy of the city and the neighborhood.

Rendering of the building with our installation.


Conceptual Rendering Video:


The Details:  We are constructing (22) 7-foot-tall aluminum frames, each containing a unique assembly of natural tree branches and colorful woven elements designed to catch and rotate in the wind. 

Prototype:


The Campaign: We are financing this project ourselves. The sheer scale of the piece and the safety/durability requirements for the long term outdoor installation force us to work with strong welded metal.  We are campaigning to raise funds to cover the cost of the aluminum tube, tube bending, and welding.   Anything helps!  Thanks!

Goal: $3000

story:
Crafty Combat will be the worlds first crafting competition interactive website!  Our users will use their creativity to win a variety of cash and prizes! 

Customers will subscribe to receive a monthly box of "crafty combat supplies"  Items will have a theme every month, for example "summertime".  Some contests will be specific, for example, "make a picture frame with the included items".  Others will be a free for all, use your creativity and make anything your heart desires! 

Each box will include a "combat card" with a unique code.  When a subscriber completes their product they will take a photo of the item and the card (showing the code clearly).  They will then submit their entry.

Subscribers will submit their projects to an e-mail or website, where a panel of qualified judges will select a group of finalists. 

The finalists will be uploaded to our website and social media accounts.  People will then vote for their favorites through our website.  This will encourage finalists to share their entries through social media, allowing Crafty Combat to continue to grow! 

Even if your product is not selected as a finalist for our competition, you will have a finished project to keep and display. 

Aside from our monthly subscription contests, we will also offer contests that do not require a subscription box.  As well as crafting and DIY blogs and tutorials!

All funds raised will be used for website development, app development, and inventory. 

Our main focus will be creating a seamless easy to use website that will easily incorporate social media. This will allow finalists to simply share their entries with their family and friends on various platforms.

story:
Who Am I: 

My name is John Gutoskey. I am an artist, designer, and collector who has lived in Ann Arbor, Michigan for the past 27 years. I have had a studio practice based in my home for almost as long. I love to make art, and I love to teach others how to do the same. I have shown my artwork all over the country in galleries and at art fairs.  In the late 1980’s, with a BFA in Theater Design and a background in costume crafts, I moved to Ann Arbor to teach costume design and costume crafts at the University of Michigan's Department of Theater. A quarter of a century later, I went back to graduate school  at the University of Michigan where I completed an MFA this past spring with a focus on printmaking and a certificate in LGBTQ Studies. 


What I Am Doing:

I am launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to set up the A2 Print Studio —an independent print studio where I will continue to make my own work, and also offer an affordable space where other people can learn printmaking and have access to a press. The future home of the A2 Print Studio will be my 320 square foot garage that was renovated into a studio space 15 years ago. It has good natural light, track lighting, electricity, heat, AC, and plumbing. Best of all—no monthly rent!   I will offer open studio days where artists can rent time to work in the print studio and use the press to create their own work, as well as workshops where people can learn how to make prints.This is a way for me to give back to the Ann Arbor community that has supported me as as an artist and designer through the years, and as a way to create a larger community of artists who want to engage in printmaking and have access to a printmaking studio. 

Through a small group of angel donors, I have already been able to raise $20,000 --enough money to be able to buy a combination relief and litho press with the basic tools and accessories needed to operate it, as well as an exposure unit to do photolithography. I am halfway to my goal of $40,000. Please consider helping me reach this goal. In return you will receive, along with much gratitude, an original handmade print produced by the A2 Print Studio.


What Is Needed & What You Get

The Need:

I still  need to raise $20,000 to purchase the rest of the myriad of tools, supplies, and materials needed to set up a fully functioning print studio. The money will go towards plumbing for a sink, rollers, brayers, ink, drying rack, wide format printer, transparency film,   3 hole punch system, tear bars, rulers, ball grain litho plates, photo litho plates, photopolymer plates, copper plates, newsprint, paper, linoleum, intaglio tools, gum arabic, aquatint screen, tannic acid, asphaltum, lithotine, plate developer & pad, plate finisher, silk screen photo emulsion, hand shears, mag carb, vegetable oil, tusche, acetone, denatured alcohol, mineral spirits, knives, scrapers, rosin, talc, tympan grease, sponges, and cheesecloth--to name a few. 

If I do not reach the goal, I will work with what is raised, and fund the remaining needs as I go--after the studio is up and running. I plan to have the studio set up and ready to go by September of this year.

What You Get:

PRINTS!! Handmade Original Prints produced in the A2 Print Studio. 

You will have your choice of a selection of handmade original prints produced and created especially for this Indiegogo campaign at the A2 Print Studio. (See gallery for some of my previous print work.)


You Can Help Out In Other Ways:

Of course, I realize that not everybody has a lot of disposable income in these tough economic times. But every contribution helps, even a small one.

And you can help out in other ways too. 

  • Share this campaign on your social media networks.
  • Email 10 of your friends about the project, and encourage them to contribute.
  • Tell your friends about the A2 Print Studio, and suggest they look it up on Facebook. 
  • Let your friends who are artists know about the A2 Print Studio, especially if they live in the Ann Arbor/Detroit Metro area!

Thank you so much for any help you can offer. 

 Sincerely,

John Gutoskey and the A2 Print Studio

Thank you so much for any help you can offer.  Sincerely,John Gutoskey and the A2 Print Studio

story:
About Public Transformation

The 2016 presidential election revealed major rifts in our country - most notably, a profound disconnect between urban and rural areas. It revealed that we are not talking to each other openly enough, that we don’t understand each other deeply enough, and that many assumptions are being made on all sides of the conversation.

Theater and social practice artist Ashley Hanson, whose large-scale public performances put rural life at their center, was curious how other artists working in rural areas were contemplating these geographic divides. As an artist who works in both rural and urban areas, she set out to investigate what her responsibility is in this conversation: "How can I do my work better? How can it dig deeper to better connect individuals and communities across these great divides? I decided to do what I know best: ask questions, listen deeply to the answers, and to share what I learn in a way that helps us all connect, and move forward, together."

So, she bought a little yellow school bus and set off on a 6,200 mile high-paced fact-finding mission, visiting 127 artists in 24 communities with populations of under 10,000. For six-weeks, the little yellow school bus ("Gus") acted as a cross-country mobile artist residency, with a rotating cast of Mobile Artists-in-Residence documenting the work of rural-based creatives, cultural leaders, and arts organizations, as they make their place in American culture.

The Department of Public Transformation left from San Francisco on January 4, 2017, visiting artists living in communities with population under 10,000 from coast-to-coast, participating in the Women's March on Washington on January 21, 2017, heading back through Minnesota, and ending in Colorado on February 6, 2017. The stories collected on this journey were shared at The Rural Arts & Culture Summit on June 6-8, 2017 in Morris, MN, and at an initial gallery exhibition at The Outpost collaborative space in Winona, MN in October / November 2017. We continue to share these stories (and incorporate new ones) across the country through artist talks, gallery exhibitions, conference presentations, and good ol' fashioned conversations.

 

Help the Department of Public Transformation Continue the Journey...

After the initial 6-week Research Road Trip, it became clear that the Department of Public Transformation journey was far from over. The Department continues to expand and adapt to find new ways to tell stories, share knowledge and understanding, and connect artists all over the country. What started as a road trip has turned into an ongoing artist inquiry and rich national network of rural makers, movers, and shakers. America is big, and we are so excited to see what the future holds.

We are so thrilled that Springboard for the Arts, Creative Exchange, Art of the Rural, and additional rural practitioners have joined us as project partners. In addition to sharing our findings along the way on their national platforms, our partners have also contributed financial and in-kind support. Check out a short video from our partners about their support of Public Transformation!
 

 

You can join the journey! A contribution of ANY amount will make you an official member of the Department of Public Transformation. So, climb aboard the little yellow school bus, become a member of the Department, and let’s hit the road!

In addition to the project website, we also post updates on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter - we hope you follow along!

Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/publictransformation
Instagram: @publictransformation
Twitter: @publictransform
#publictransformation

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, we still want you to be a part of the Department of Public Transformation! There are a few ways you can be involved:

  • Sign up for our newsletter and follow-along at www.publictransformation.org
  • Share this campaign and stories from the road on social media
  • Contribute art based on the project - contact me if you are interested in this and we can talk details! publictransformation@gmail.com
  • Call or email us to check in! We're always traveling around the country, and we could use the company! ;)

If you have any questions, ideas, feedback, thoughts, concerns, please reach out. 

Thank you for your time and support!

Love, 

Ash & the Department of Public Transformation
story_txt:
About Public Transformation
The 2016 presidential election revealed major rifts in our country - most notably, a profound disconnect between urban and rural areas. It revealed that we are not talking to each other openly enough, that we don’t understand each other deeply enough, and that many assumptions are being made on all sides of the conversation.
Theater and social practice artist Ashley Hanson, whose large-scale public performances put rural life at their center, was curious how other artists working in rural areas were contemplating these geographic divides. As an artist who works in both rural and urban areas, she set out to investigate what her responsibility is in this conversation: "How can I do my work better? How can it dig deeper to better connect individuals and communities across these great divides? I decided to do what I know best: ask questions, listen deeply to the answers, and to share what I learn in a way that helps us all connect, and move forward, together."
So, she bought a little yellow school bus and set off on a 6,200 mile high-paced fact-finding mission, visiting 127 artists in 24 communities with populations of under 10,000. For six-weeks, the little yellow school bus ("Gus") acted as a cross-country mobile artist residency, with a rotating cast of Mobile Artists-in-Residence documenting the work of rural-based creatives, cultural leaders, and arts organizations, as they make their place in American culture.

The Department of Public Transformation left from San Francisco on January 4, 2017, visiting artists living in communities with population under 10,000 from coast-to-coast, participating in the Women's March on Washington on January 21, 2017, heading back through Minnesota, and ending in Colorado on February 6, 2017. The stories collected on this journey were shared at The Rural Arts & Culture Summit on June 6-8, 2017 in Morris, MN, and at an initial gallery exhibition at The Outpost collaborative space in Winona, MN in October / November 2017. We continue to share these stories (and incorporate new ones) across the country through artist talks, gallery exhibitions, conference presentations, and good ol' fashioned conversations.
 
Help the Department of Public Transformation Continue the Journey...
After the initial 6-week Research Road Trip, it became clear that the Department of Public Transformation journey was far from over. The Department continues to expand and adapt to find new ways to tell stories, share knowledge and understanding, and connect artists all over the country. What started as a road trip has turned into an ongoing artist inquiry and rich national network of rural makers, movers, and shakers. America is big, and we are so excited to see what the future holds.
We are so thrilled that Springboard for the Arts, Creative Exchange, Art of the Rural, and additional rural practitioners have joined us as project partners. In addition to sharing our findings along the way on their national platforms, our partners have also contributed financial and in-kind support. Check out a short video from our partners about their support of Public Transformation! 

 

You can join the journey! A contribution of ANY amount will make you an official member of the Department of Public Transformation. So, climb aboard the little yellow school bus, become a member of the Department, and let’s hit the road!
In addition to the project website, we also post updates on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter - we hope you follow along!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/publictransformationInstagram: @publictransformationTwitter: @publictransform#publictransformation
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot contribute financially, we still want you to be a part of the Department of Public Transformation! There are a few ways you can be involved:

Sign up for our newsletter and follow-along at www.publictransformation.org

Share this campaign and stories from the road on social media
Contribute art based on the project - contact me if you are interested in this and we can talk details! publictransformation@gmail.com
Call or email us to check in! We're always traveling around the country, and we could use the company! ;)

If you have any questions, ideas, feedback, thoughts, concerns, please reach out. 
Thank you for your time and support!
Love, 
Ash & the Department of Public Transformation

story:
"When I first began 15 years ago, I knew that BunnyKitty would be life long journey for me, but since then she has evolved into more than just a painting on the side of a building, or a simple mark left behind. I’ve been painting the story of BunnyKitty on walls throughout the globe, and refining the words that would share the story of these characters.  After years of developing designs and painting dozens of scenes, I am very excited to present the The Origins Of BunnyKitty: A Tale For All Ages to the world!" - David  "Persue" Ross 


We’ve completed the design and layout of the book and plush toy, but we need you to help us bring this illustrated children's book to life! By supporting this campaign you can receive discounted copies of "The Origins of BunnyKitty", the BunnyKitty plush (before it hits stores) and access to the limited edition BunnyKitty snapback and prints… Help us bring bring the story of BunnyKitty to the world and present this story to a larger audience! Check out some of our amazing perks and help us bring this world to life! 

    

      

Persue (pronounced "per-SWAY") also known as Dave Ross has a life time degree in design, illustration, product development and graffiti.  Hailing from San Diego his design instinct and visual aesthetic has been a staple of the west coast graffiti style, nearly a hundred skateboard deck designs, and across the early phases of street wear.  You might not have heard Dave Ross' name but you’ve been visually influenced by his design for the past 3 decades.  As a hired gun his personal accomplishments as an artist has been more subtle as he is quite humble in his talents and accomplishments.

Turning the page, Ross has been refining the story and concept of BunnyKitty for the past 15 years. In the early days BunnyKitty started to appear on walls in Southern California and as time progressed so did the illustrations, character development and ultimately the story of a lost cat that is taken in by a family of bunnies, provided a magic suit and the power to be exceptional.

“The Origins of BunnyKitty, A Tale for All Ages” is a story for the entire family, a story of acceptance, perseverance and finding one's place in the world. Beyond the story, Persue has worked tirelessly to create a unique plush toy that is not only a collectible but brings to life BunnyKitty and her sidekick Twurp for youth to use their imagination and create their own BunnyKitty journey.

Pairing Ross' experience with designing and developing footwear and clothing, he has developed a lifestyle brand for the entire family. With your support we will have the capabilities and strength to finish production on the plush toy and the hard cover book.

It’s our pleasure to provide early bird supporters with exclusive discounts and packages of BunnyKitty merchandise that has the magic to bring families, classrooms, and friends together in the enjoyment of this soon to be classic tale.

                                            

It has been years in the works building the story of BunnyKitty, and with the passing of Ross' Mother last fall it’s become even more important to share this story with the world. With each sale from this collection we will be donating a portion of the proceeds to Alzheimer's research in memory of Ross's mother Diane "Monny" Satenstein, with the hopes that a cure will alleviate other families from the burden and pain of this disease.

    


"Along with my friends Dan and Jesse at 1xRUN in Detroit we’ve been working on the plush and book for over a year.  We chose to bring this project to Indiegogo for a few reasons, but first off, we’ve invested over $15,000 into the project. So far we have created an amazing plush toy and designed a beautiful book, but the reason we wanted to present this project on Indiegogo first was to help bring more awareness to the story behind BunnyKitty.  With the book designed and ready to print all we’re waiting on is the final production of the book, and with your help we will start printing the book in mid-March and have everything ready to ship just weeks after this campaign ends! Thank you for your support #BunnyKittyLovesYou",  Dave "Persue" Ross

story:
About Annie Terrazzo

I have been an artist living in Los Angeles for 17 years. In that time I have sold countless works, been in some fantastic shows, and had many great opportunities. My work has evolved as I have as a person and I have achieved more than I ever set out to do. Having said that, I have been disappointed with the regular art system and have always been more attracted to doing things myself. When The Other Art Fair contacted me and asked me to participate in their first Los Angeles exhibition, I thought it would be a great opportunity for me to not only represent myself and my work but also strive to create a body of work that challenged me.

So Why The Other Art Fair? 

The Other Art Fair is the leading artist fair for art lovers to meet and buy direct from the very best emerging and undiscovered artists.

With fairs across the globe in the UK and Australia, each edition of The Other Art Fair showcases work by a selection of talented artists handpicked by a committee of art industry experts.

Celebrated for its unique visitor experience, The Other Art Fair inspires and delights with a tightly curated and distinctive programme of immersive fair features that create a platform for the ‘unexpected’ at each fair.

Achieving My Goal

Achieving this goal is not done on the cheap. I need new materials and time to mess up and fail. I need to cover the booth costs and professional set up/tear down. Without your help, there would be no way for me to fund this dream. 

For every $50 donation, I will provide a set of 4 postcards featuring work from my new show.

For every $100 donation, I will provide a signed and numbered hand embellished 11 x 14 print (5 artworks to choose from)

For every $500 donation, you can pick an artwork from my collection to have permanently.

For every $700 donation, I will create a custom artwork of your choice. Want your family drawn? Your dog? Or something you've always wanted? Nows the time!

The Impact

It's not easy going in a different direction. It takes guts and patience and drive. After 17 years of being an artist, I feel itis time for me to say something new with my work. The world has changed and so have I. Your donation will help me build up the foundation for this new body of work and get me focused on the next stage of my artistic career and a place to show it off!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this message. Even if you cannot support today, spread the word about my work and let me know you are with me!

story:
Three years ago, I decided to fund Chibinendo Art. A transformative service to break the barrier to entry in the professional grade of customized products. After two years of training my abilities and a year of trial, I believe that people would love the idea of having customised sculptures, but they might think that are out of their league or where to look for.

With this campaign, I want to affirm Chibinendo Art and its commissioning, designing, and creative services. Moreover, this campaign will offer Chibinendo Art stability and opportunities to grow and offer better customer experience.

 

Most of the funds will go to cover the costs of materials. Some of them are:

  • Different types of clay
  • Paints
  • Brushes
  • Varnishes

I will also purchase new tools that will help me improve the quality of the sculptures and the making process faster:

  • Clay extruder
  • A small turntable
  • Magnifying glasses

The rest will go to cover the costs of shipping and production of this campaign. 

A chance to experiment the creativity, quality, and the efficiency of Chibinendo Art with a huge discount. All the rewards are created so you can choose between all the different products that you can currently purchase in my shop but with at least a 35% discount, and free shipping (or just £2 if outside EU). I'm specialized in merchandising and fantasy themes, but don't get confused, the images of the rewards are just a glimpse of what you can pre-order ;) As you choose the subject and theme, anything can be possible! If you don't have any subject in mind, tell me something that you like and I will improvise for you! Example: if you like dogs, but you are undecided which one, you can just specify at the subject "dogs".

When will you choose the subject or theme? After you choose your reward and checkout, you will receive an email confirmation from IndieGoGo and a personal one from me/Chibinendo Art. You will be able to answer to this email specifying the subject-character, story, movie... You don't need to rush! You can give it as many thoughts as you want until the campaign finishes. But the sooner you decide, the sooner I will start creating for you!

Crowdfunding is not about just giving money, you are making my dream of working in the sculpture world real. Furthermore, by letting me create your unique sculpture, you also highlight the value of distinctive art over mass-production.

 

 

I put a lot of dedication and hard-work in every creation, thus delivering all the rewards on time can be challenging. But some more time and patience will be worth your perfect sculpture. 

I will be posting updates on my Instagram and Twitter page @chibinendoart and will always make sure to deliver my best!

If for any reason you are not able to back this campaign, don't stress out! Everything counts, you can still make the difference by sharing this campaign with the buttons next to the video.
