story:
Short Summary

People in depressed areas deserve an opportunity to enjoy the arts.

Hello:  My name is Cecil Varney.  I have been an officer and program chair for the Tug Valley Arts Council for many years.  In fact the Arts Council was established in 1973, and has presented a series of entertaining artists every since.

Tug Valley is the area around South Western West Virginia, and Eastern Kentucky, sometimes referred to the Heart of the Billion Dollar Coalfield.  In these economically depressed times, especially for the Coal Industry, that Billion Dollar figure is greatly reduced.

The Tug Valley Arts Council consists of a Board of Directors, made up of all volunteers.  There is a carpenter, a teacher, two lawyers, a stay at home dad, a hardware store clerk, a banker, a motel owner, and a housewife, among others, who tirelessly give of their time to help achieve the mission of the Arts Council…"Promoting, encouraging and arousing interest in and support for the arts…"

With the war on coal, times are really bad in the Tug Valley region.  The Arts Council budget  depends on contributions from businesses, and individuals, along with a small percentage coming in the form of a grant from the State of West Virginia.  This past season saw a major reduction in the number of businesses that sponsor artist presentations, as well as a reduction in "Members" who contribute to and attend our shows.  For the first time in years, we are looking at a budget deficit to the extent we may not be able to pay our contractual obligations to the artists, and to other vendors, such as sound and light technicians.  Contributions will help us finish out this season, and hopefully give us a leg up on the next season, which is already planned.

  • What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for the contract fees for artists, housing and hospitality expenses, sound system and light rental, and upkeep and repairs to our venue (a former high school auditorium).  Artists vary greatly on their fees.  We have paid as much as $15,000 for an act, and as little as $2500.  We try to present up to eight high quality shows per season (September through May) but have had to reduce that amount to the point where we can only realistically plan on four shows for next season… unless we get more contributions.

For each contributor, we will list their name in our seasonal brochure, which is distributed throughout the region.  

The Impact

Your contribution will keep the arts alive in an area where they are diminishing day by day.  Our areas are losing population yearly, and therefore music and the arts are suffering in the area schools.  That is why we make sure we take our programs into the schools so that children of all backgrounds have the opportunity to see and hear first class artists.  The Tug Valley Arts Council stands alone in promoting and presenting a performing artist series that is enjoyable yet displays a wide variety of music, dance and theater… live performances that could not be seen without having to travel to larger cities, and paying much higher admission fees. 

Risks & Challenges

It is obvious that we, as an Arts Council cannot invigorate a turnaround in the economy of the Tug Valley.  We may be destined to failure in the future even if we are able to reach our goal in this campaign.  But we are hopeful that if we can keep the Arts Council alive for a little while longer, we will be able to pull ourselves up by our bootstraps, and survive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then help by getting the word out about our campaign, and the need for preserving the arts, and our musical heritage

Your contribution will keep the arts alive in an area where they are diminishing day by day.  Our areas are losing population yearly, and therefore music and the arts are suffering in the area schools.  That is why we make sure we take our programs into the schools so that children of all backgrounds have the opportunity to see and hear first class artists.  The Tug Valley Arts Council stands alone in promoting and presenting a performing artist series that is enjoyable yet displays a wide variety of music, dance and theater… live performances that could not be seen without having to travel to larger cities, and paying much higher admission fees. 

Risks & Challenges
 It is obvious that we, as an Arts Council cannot invigorate a turnaround in the economy of the Tug Valley.  We may be destined to failure in the future even if we are able to reach our goal in this campaign.  But we are hopeful that if we can keep the Arts Council alive for a little while longer, we will be able to pull ourselves up by our bootstraps, and survive.
    Other Ways You Can Help  If you can't contribute, then help by getting the word out about our campaign, and the need for preserving the arts, and our musical heritage

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brisa Areli Muñoz and I am the Artistic Director of Applied Theatre Collective, an organization that is dedicated to promoting constructive social change, strengthening community, and building capability by providing a creative space for dialogue through the arts. 

Applied Theatre Collective has been invited by The Center for Peace and Conflict Resolution Studies at the University of Duhok to present at the first annual Peacebuilding and Education Interdisciplinary Symposium in Iraq. 

The presentation, "Helping Helpers: Establishing Creative Space to Support Educators Teaching History and Peacebuilding in Iraq", takes an international approach, to discuss how storytelling and applied theatre methodologies can foster spaces to support educators and practitioners who are teaching on topics of education and peacebuilding. 

The Impact

The aim of the symposium is to raise awareness of ongoing educational efforts in peacebuilding in Iraq and in neighboring states, to invite critical consideration of them in terms of theory and practice, and to catalyze further research and action related to new or expanded programs or projects in this area. The symposium will bring together promising scholars from fields related to education and peacebuilding from Iraq, elsewhere in the Middle East and the neighboring region, the United States, as well as Iraqi policymakers in education and higher education.

To take part in this conference would help secure my future and career as an artist for social change, a path that I have been forging for myself since graduating with my Masters in Applied Theatre from The City University of New York. 

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make this happen, I'll need to cover: 

  • The cost of travel, visa and my time there; entrance to the conference and accomodation is covered
  • If you contribute you will recieve an email with a photo of my time there, a personalized post card and/or small souvenir!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that money may be tight, therefore if you are unable to support me financially, I would love it if you could share my efforts with family or friends. Thank you for your continued support!

story:
WHO WE ARE?

‘De Gulden Leeuw’ is a non-profit organization which organizes the exhibition ‘The Importance of Being …’, dedicated to the rich Belgian contemporary art world. It brings 40 of Belgium’s most prominent artists together. The exhibition will travel to four important museums in Latin America along one year and a half. Plural discourses and transversal approaches through a wide range of artistic supports make it possible to highlight nowadays crucial problematics worldwide in order to think on possible connections with other latitudes while mapping similarities and differences.

The goal has been to go beyond the notion of Belgium. In this sense, subjects related to power and memory, to the binomial identity-alterity, conflicts and borders, human relations with both the technosphere and the biosphere in the context of the globalization are developed on the exhibition.

Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes, Havana, Cuba: 13 Feb to 26 Apr 2015
Museo de Arte Contemporáneo, Buenos Aires, Argentina: 4 Jul to 12 Sep 2015
Museu de Arte Moderna, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: 2 Dec, 2015 to 14 Feb 2016
Museu de Arte Contemporânea da Universidade de São Paulo, Brazil: 11 Apr to 14 Jul 2016

Curator: Sara Alonso Gómez
Director: Bruno Devos
www.theimportanceofbeing.be

WHAT DO WE NEED FUNDING FOR?

To document this event we will publish a 400 pages, high-quality catalogue. The catalogue will also become a fifth exhibition space, with its own logic and features.

To finance part of this beautiful publication, we need your help to fund graphic design, digital imaging, authors and our translation partner.

The catalogue will introduce the artists who participate on the exhibition in a wider context, including also other works produced along their career. Therefore it will be an essential guide for anyone interested or professionally linked to global contemporary art. The catalogue will be a reference work for future generations.

There will be 2 versions in 3 languages, one version Spanish/Portuguese/English and another version Dutch/French/English. The catalogue includes texts of Cathérine Mayeur, Hans Theys, Christophe Van Gerrewey and Sara Alonso Gómez as curator. Design by Livin Mentens (Sint-Lucas Antwerp), Alain Six for digital imaging. The Catalogue will be printed by printing house De Bie and published by Stockmans.

Catalogue specifications:

Title: The Importance of Being … A Panorama on Belgian contemporary art through the artworks of 40 artists
230 x 290 mm portrait
Hardcover edition
Full Colour, High quality paper
400 pages, with more then 250 image pages
2 versions : 1 Latin-American version in SPA/PORT/UK, 1 version in NL/FR/UK

Participating Artists, explored in the catalogue: Marcel Broodthaers, Chantal Akerman, Francis Alÿs, Charif Benhelima, Guillaume Bijl, Michaël Borremans, Dirk Braeckman, Jacques Charlier, David Claerbout, Leo Copers, Patrick Corillon, Cel Crabeels, Berlinde De Bruyckere, Jan De Cock, Peter de Cupere, Carl De Keyzer, Raoul De Keyser, Edith Dekyndt, Wim Delvoye, Fred Eerdekens, Jan Fabre, Michel François, Kendell Geers, Johan Grimonprez, Ann Veronica Janssens, Marie-Jo Lafontaine, Jacques Lizène, Kris Martin, Hans Op de Beeck, Walter Swennen,  Pascale Marthine Tayou, Ana Torfs, Joëlle Tuerlinckx, Philippe Vandenberg, Koen van den Broek, Anne-Mie Van Kerckhoven, Koen Vanmechelen, Lieve Van Stappen, Bruno Vekemans, Angel Vergara Santiago.

HOW WE WILL USE FUNDS

4 Authors: 4 x €2.000 = €8.000
Concept & Graphic design (Livin Mentens): €10.000
Digital Imaging (Alain Six): €5.000
Translations: € 16.500
Lay-Out and Production: €7.500
TOTAL = €47.000

Other costs like printing, paper, bookbinding and distribution will be funded by our private partners and sales of the catalogue. The total budget for the catalogue is €97.000

FIND, LIKE AND SHARE

After pledging your support, please help to spread the word about ‘The Importance of Being …’ by sharing this link with your contacts.

  www.facebook.com/TIOB2015

  https://vimeo.com/user38954737

  https://twitter.com/hashtag/theimportanceofbeing?src=hash


  http://www.slideshare.net/brunodevos

www.theimportanceofbeing.be

Thanks for your support.

story:
A Garter Girls Burly-Q Overview

The Garter Girls are a burlesque performance collective from Calgary, Alberta Canada. We come at burlesque from varied artistic backgrounds from theatre to dance to visual art.  We produce some of the best most entertaining striptease shows in Alberta!

Every year since 2012 we've brought a special guest headliner from around the globe to perform with us in a theatrical showcase full of humour, sex and intrigue! We're thrilled to be at it again on February 12th and 13th, 2016 at the Engineered Air Theatre with a brand new headliner sure to amaze our Calgary audience!  Our 2016 headliner, Mr. Gorgeous hold two titles from The Burlesque Hall of Fame Weekend including Most Comedic (2013) and King of Burlesque (2014)! Combining circus, comedy, and charisma, Gorgeous amuses audiences of all types with his light hearted approach to contemporary burlesque and will be the perfect addition to our Valentine's Day Weekend shows!

In 2016 we are planning TWO nights of sensuality and striptease instead of a one night only showcase.  The cost to produce these shows will be $12 000 and we're offering some amazing perks through indiegogo to help offset the cost of producing the show. Perks include VIP tickets exclusively available through indiegogo, hula hoops, tassel pasties, g-strings, an exclusive backstage pass and more! 

Our goal is to entertain our audiences with incredible top notch performers, quality and style.  Your support is integral in helping us elevate the burlesque experience in Calgary and giving our artists a platform to share their stories. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that many may face financial constraints so if you feel inclined, please share our campaign and tell friends about the show! 

We will also be holding a fundraiser on July 18th at Community Wise to help raise money for the 2016 shows. Cost is $25 in advance or $30 at the door. Check out thegartergirls.com for details!

story:
Short Summary

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

What is This Crazy thing?!

In short: SpliceUp is an exposure producing, and revenue generating machine for writers, musicians, and visual artists.

A SpliceUp is a new form of media, comprised of Visual Art, Story, and Music. Splicing Up is when an artist combines their work with the two different categories of media. The resulting artistic expression is a SpliceUp. The artist has added additional nuance by associating his/her work with complementary art. At its highest aspiration, Splice Ups will foster artist collaborations beyond the website

 

We wanted to design this site as generously as possible, so we designed 3 different galleries. Each one gives special viewing incentives to make going to each individual gallery a rewarding experience.  When this goes live, you’ll get lost admiring art details in the gallery, listening to quality music, and reading beautiful stories without eye-fatigue!

The Dream

Your work might end up on someone else’s Facebook page, riding the back of an artist you’ve never met. A SpliceUp doesn't require explicit permission from the artists you choose to collaborate with, because you are effectively promoting their work while enhancing the appeal of your own. The site is designed to make Splicing Up an effortless, common endeavor with extraordinary results for everybody. Your work might be Spliced Up with a famous artist you admire, who you've just found out admires you, or it could conceivably land on the Ellen show and you and your compatriots will find the exposure you didn't dare dream of under the current anemic state of the publishing industry.  

How is SpliceUp Unique?

What makes SpliceUp so unique is what we aren't. We aren't competing with sites hocking raw media, like Deviant Art, Purevolume, and the hundreds of online publishers. Everything you submit is published (with the exception of very offensive work, and work that is not yours). Your exposure is determined by the quality of work rather than the vain and capricious nature of publishers. Good work will automatically find its way to the top, lauded by your fellow artists, rather than soulless publishers.

Cool Features

Once you've created a Splice Up, watch your work gain popularity with visual cues. Artists will "level-up" their frame to a more Louvre style after a certain number views, musicians can also see their record change from vinyl to gold and platinum, and writers get silver and gold foil award stamps! Side scrolling allows for viewers to anticipate the popularity of the upcoming work by seeing these special accolades.

 

As you peruse the gallery of SpliceUps, you will be inspired, emboldened with a will to collaborate. Why must visual artists toil under corporate despots only to see their work launched disdainfully as artillery volleys between vying marketers, and talented musicians atrophy under the weight of radio playability, writers of clarity and insight become muddled as they try to speak the sullied tongue of Hollywood? SpliceUp is questing to defeat the soulless part of being an artist!

The site is free. We've included an "experience bar" on your profile that measures the traffic on your profile page, if you are receiving a lot of hits it might be more lucrative to upgrade to a premium account and allow for ad-click revenue. Or you can forego the extra revenue and choose to remove the ads from your profile.

Readability is important that's why the reader will be able to change settings for stories that they're reading--things like inverting white on black, black on white, and font settings. 

Viewers will be able to look at art in full screen, to really admire the art.

SpliceUp also engages users with visual cues to track popularity and involvement within the SpliceUp community, all stored within your individual DNA strand. Think of it as your Splice Up portfolio.

 

What we need!

The scale of this project is ambitious, and in order to make a utopian society where music, art, and story harmoniously congregate, we must assemble a legendary team of programmers. Right now we’re halfway there, but we need your help. So donate some money and witness a new age of creative expression where artists are the deciding factor of what is good and not publishers, record execs, or marketers.

story:
We are a nonprofit 501 (c) (3) organization – Voices, it was founded by a group of people with diverse backgrounds, but a common passion for art and a shared belief that art brings people together.

Our first event is an exhibit of traditional Russian and Ukrainian dolls, made by contemporary artists in both countries who look for the inspiration in their roots – in traditional culture.

We have transported 60 dolls from Russia and Ukraine. Our volunteers created beautiful wall displays to exhibit the doll. We have volunteers to conduct doll making workshops for children. We also have volunteers to work with social media. The only missing piece is the exhibit space. We need to collect $5,000 for the rental.

With this exhibit we would like to give an opportunity for the artists from Russia and Ukraine to work together and for the children of Metropolitan DC area to learn about doll making and traditional Russian and Ukrainian cultures.

If you can’t make a monetary contribution, but would like to help, please share the information with your friends and family, visit our Facebook page- Voices International Art Initiative.

If you would like to share your expertise in marketing, web design, fundraising please write to us – contact@voices-dc.org. If you are interested in various forms of textile design and can help us with the assembling of the exhibit and our workshops please write to us as well. Thank you!

story:
Our Mission

319 Fest started with the sole mission of supporting local artisans and bands by raising awareness through a fun and exciting 1 day festival that packs in more genres and art styles than the typical festival.  Since 2010 we have been bringing local bands and artists together in the 319 area code. We play all day and party into the night with various music genres including: Metal, Hip-Hop, Acoustic, Folk, Alternative, and Rock! While you are going from stage to stage checking out amazing bands, take time to go explore the art area. Along with our 50+ bands, we have 20+ super talented airbrush artists, painters, photographers, mixed media artists and illustrators! 

This year is the fifth consecutive year of 319 FEST and we're hitting three different cities in the Eastern Iowa area: Iowa City, Cedar Rapids, and Waterloo.



Where is your money going

The new locations are ideal for establishing the future of the festival.  But these new locations have added more expense. This is why we need you to join us now to help cover the initial out-of-pocket expenses. The goal is $5,000! With each donation exceeding $5, we will get you the best gear from our amazing local talent. Your contribution will help us add more to this festival to make it huge! 

This festival is completely volunteer run and every dollar you give will go directly to the following types of expenses:
- Insurance ( $800)
- Stage rental ($1000)
- Generators (100+)
- Printing and Promotions ($800)
- Facility Rentals ($3000+)
- Art Zone, signage and other basic supplies ($100)

Obviously the festival expenses exceed our goal.  This is the bare minimum of what is needed to make 319 Fest happen at the start.

Challenges & Risks

With this being our fifth year, we recognize that historically art and music fests which showcase local original talent are unable to survive and grow on ticket sales alone. We rely heavily on donations so that we can help our music and art community grow and prosper.  Another challenge we face is finding reliable volunteers to follow through with the festival.


Other Ways You Can Help

No matter what your interest or passion there is a place for you within Nexus and 319FEST. We know what's going on and at any given moment have several projects in the works. If you are interested in getting more involved in the community of arts and music please introduce yourself to us through email at experiencenexus@gmail.com. We would love to meet you and help you get connected.

This is your festival, help keep it alive!


319 Fest is Presented by Nexus Entertainment Arts and local bands, musicians, artists and arts organization.   To learn more about Nexus Entertainment Arts visit www.NexusEntertainmentArts.Org

No matter what your interest or passion there is a place for you within Nexus and 319FEST. We know what's going on and at any given moment have several projects in the works. If you are interested in getting more involved in the community of arts and music please introduce yourself to us through email at experiencenexus@gmail.com. We would love to meet you and help you get connected.

This is your festival, help keep it alive!



319 Fest is Presented by Nexus Entertainment Arts and local bands, musicians, artists and arts organization.   To learn more about Nexus Entertainment Arts visit www.NexusEntertainmentArts.Org

story:
Hola, Soy Agus, si has llegado hasta aquí, probablemente me conocerás como el fotógrafo de GuardeirosBJJ. Seguramente conocerás mis perfiles de instagram y Facebook y estarás hart@ de verme en las competiciones de Jiujitsu brasileño. Quizá te sorprenda que esté organizando este proyecto puesto que siempre me has visto con una cámara encima y unos súper objetivos. Lo que quizá no sepas es que, cada vez que me has visto sacando fotos y grabando vídeos en las competiciones lo estaba haciendo alquilando el equipo por un coste muy elevado y sin obtener beneficios por mi trabajo, como mucho y si llegaba, cubriendo costes. Todo lo he hecho sólo porque comparto la misma pasión que tú, el Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Hoy por hoy no puedo seguir asumiendo estos costes, y me es imposible realizar la inversión necesaria para adquirir el material profesional exigido para seguir cubriendo estos eventos. El material que debo comprar es una Canon Mark III y un objetivo Canon EF 70-200 f 2.8 L IS USM II. Este es el equipo que la mayoría de los fotógrafos profesionales utilizan para eventos deportivos. Además de una cámara compacta que ya he adquirido, y que estoy pagando a plazos. Tú sabes que en este deporte resulta muy dificil conseguir apoyo y patrocinios para los atletas, puedes imaginarte hasta que punto es imposible para un fotógrafo. A día de hoy estoy presente en la mayoría de las competiciones nacionales, visito todos los gimnasios que puedo en la geografía española e intento promocionar nuestro deporte, sus escuelas y atletas tanto como puedo. Hasta ahora siempre me he sentido acogido en cada escuela y gimnasio, todos y cada uno de vosotros me habéis hecho sentir parte de vuestra familia y siempre os he expresado mi gratitud con las mejores fotografías que he podido sacar en cada momento. Necesito tu ayuda, quiero mejorar la calidad de mi trabajo, pero sobre todo quiero causar un efecto en el mundo del BJJ, quiero promover nuestro deporte a nivel nacional e internacional. Con la fotografía conseguimos una mayor difusión del brazilian jiu jitsu, de sus atletas y de la comunidad. Una mayor difusión implica mejoras para el arte suave de nuestro país, más patrocinadores interesados y mejores condiciones. Si me has visto en las competiciones, sabes que soy el primero en llegar y el último en marcharme, pero cuando llego a casa el trabajo continúa, hay que editar y crear contenido nuevo a diario. Apoyar esta campaña es una manera de estimular y valorar mi trabajo para que pueda seguir creando recuerdos gratuitos de nuestras hazañas y vivencias en el BJJ. Risks and challenges Sé que es un proyecto ambicioso, sé que muchos no lo entenderán, pero tengo muchas ideas imposibles de llevar a cabo sin ayuda. Quiero mejorar el impacto del BJJ en España y en el mundo, y necesito de toda la colaboración posible, por muy pequeña sea, todos sumamos. ¡GRACIAS!


Hi, I’m Agus, if you have landed here you probably know me as the photographer of GuardeirosBJJ. Perhaps you know my profiles on Instagram and Facebook, and you are most likely fed up of seeing me at every Brazilian Jiu Jitsu tournament. You might be surprised of finding me organizing this project because you have always seen me with a camera and some super nice lens. What you may not know is that every single time you saw me taking pictures and filming videos in tournaments, I was renting all the equipment for a really high cost, without having any benefits and, usually, without covering the costs of the renting and travels. Everything I did was because I share the same passion as you… BJJ. Nowadays I can’t keep assuming all those costs and it’s impossible for me to invest what it is necessary to acquire the professional material required to cover these events. The equipment I must acquire is a camera Canon Mark III + lens Canon EF 70-200 f 2.8 L IS USM II. This is the equipment that almost any professional photographer uses to take pictures at a sporting event; besides a compact camera that I have already bought and I am paying in installments. You know how difficult it is for an athlete to get support and sponsorships in this sport, you can imagine that for a photographer it’s just something impossible to achieve. At the moment I am taking pictures in almost every national tournament, I try to visit as much BJJ schools as I can all around the country, and I try to promote our sport, its academies and athletes as much as I can. I need your help, I want to improve the quality of my work but what I want the most, it’s to cause an effect in the BJJ world, I want to promote our sport nationally and internationally. Through photography we can reach more far-reaching for Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, its athletes and community. Widespreading implies improvements for the gentle art in our country, more sponsors interested and better conditions for everybody. If you have ever seen me in a tournament, you know that I am always the first one arriving and the last one leaving the place. But the truth is that my work still continues when I get home, I must keep editing and creating new and original content daily. To support this campaign is a way to estimulate and value my work, and, specially, it’s the only way I have to keep creating memories of our Bjj adventures for free. Risks and challenges I know that this is an ambitious project, I know that a lot of people won’t understand it, but I have a lot of ideas that are impossible to accomplish without your help. I want to improve the bounce of BJJ in Spain and the world and I need as much help as possible, every small contribution counts. Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi, my name is Denny Hunter; I’m an art facilitator from Edinburgh in bonny Scotland. In my day job I help to present artwork for exhibitions and I’m also a professional picture framer. I work closely with conservators and curators to present art and history to a wide range of audiences.

I am also the creator of Artobotic and Brexit Art Machine which were set up to make the ownership of  art more accessible to the wider public via the use of vintage vending machines in public spaces. I garnered the support of Turner Prize nominated artists and Royal academicians such as Jake & Dinos Chapman, David Mach and others such as Unskilled Worker and Kennard Philips.

I like to create conversations around art and our culture!

On my way back from work in the ancient heart of Edinburgh I pass the statue of Greyfriar’s Bobby sculpted by William Brodie in 1873 set on top of a water fountain all commissioned by a real life Mary Poppins who made magical things happen with her inherited fortune. Every year the statue’s nose is rubbed by millions of passing tourists for good luck but this is not an old tradition- The Bobbie’s nose started to be rubbed for luck around about 2011 (I blame Derron Brown!) and was repatinated in 2013 to protect the bronze below. People have continued to rub his nose and now his nose is very shiny which is not good! It means that the bare bronze of the 147 year old statue is exposed to the elements and could ‘pit’ and oxidise.

So... I’ve decided to do something about it- during our lockdown in Edinburgh I took a silicone impression of the Bobby’s nose and set about reproducing the nose using the ‘cold cast bronze’ method so that people could buy their own Bobby nose to rub wherever they are in the world with a view to paying for the repatination of the statues nose.

Framing 

As a picture framer I know many of the best in the industry and so enlisted the services of Framework Picture Framers in Edinburgh to make the presentation cases within which the Bobby noses are mounted- Framework’s clients include Royalty, National galleries and private individuals such as JK Rowling so when we say that this product is high end that really is what you are getting, they have a quality of craftsmanship and attention to detail that is second to none.

Cold Cast Bronze

Cold cast bronze is a method of reproducing the look, approximate weight and tactile feel of hot cast bronze without the use of a foundry. It is made by mixing mostly genuine bronze powder with a resin binder which is trimmed and polished in the same way as it’s hot cast big brother with much the same effect. I myself will undertake the casting and finishing of these products so quality will be very important as I will be putting my name to it.

Presentation

Each Bobby nose case will come in a presentation box with a certificate of authenticity and information on the project. This aspect of the product is one that we still have to work through and you will be able to follow the progress as we design the logo and decide upon who should sign our certificates of authenticity.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get


We need the funds to make this happen! We need to pay for:

  1. Framing by Framework Picture Framers
  2. Mountains of bronze powder
  3. Resin
  4. presentation boxes
  5. Certificates of authenticity

You Will Receive 

  • A Limited Edition Large Cold Cast Bronze Bobby Nose In Obeche wood frame with Brown Mahogany finish by Framework Picture Framers.
  • A presentation box
  • Signed Certificate Of Authenticity
  • Information booklet explaining the story of these noses and the story of Greyfriars Bobby.


The Impact


When we reach 20 sales of the Large Limited Edition Bobby Noses we will allocate funds to pay for the repatination of Greyfriar’s Bobby’s nose.

By buying a Bobby Nose you are not only contributing directly to the conservation of a historic Scottish landmark but you are also buying into the concept of ‘loyalty’ which would make the Bobby nose a perfect gift for Christmas, weddings, anniversaries, birthdays and also corporate gifting.

I learned a lot about crowdfunding campaigns from the successfully funded Brexit Art Machine on Indiegogo and I love the priceless community that this builds around the idea. I intend to be as loyal to this community in this campaign as Bobby was to John Gray!

 

Risks & Challenges

There will be hurdles to overcome during this campaign. One of these will be production of the bronze noses if there is a large demand- that is why I have already been focussing on this aspect by timing production and opening up channels for help if required.

I am already a skilled craftsman with many connections in this field, my wife is an inventor and has taken many products from concept to full scale manufacture and distribution.

 

Other Ways You Can Help


You don’t need to make a purchase to help out and be part of our story...
So please spread the word by sharing this campaign on social media!

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
To any burn, anywhere, every camp brings a little something. Towering wooden artworks to burn, wild spontaneous performances in the dust, or even just a small, personal gift made with care and spare time. Our camp, the way we want to chip in, is a Mutant Vehicle camp, which - for those who haven’t had the chance to attend – is Afrikaburn speak for a moving art-piece, a motorised marvel, a performance on wheels! This is how we want to give back.: We want to make an Oasis in the desert.

A floating Island... Why?

Island fun in desert of course! Here’s the dream: Imagine climbing aboard a lush, breezy island, drinking ice cold drinks from a coconut, relaxing (or maybe something a little more energetic) in the shade and enjoying the most impossible island vibes surrounded by the dust! 

Well that sounded amazing to us, and so we are now passionately working towards turning that amazing paradisiac experience of our imaginations into an all-singing, all-driving levitating machine jungle! 

Who are we, you ask?

We are a mix of South African and international creatives based primarily in Cape Town, but spread across six countries around the world.

We are burners for life and we’ve got epic artworks, extravagant mutant vehicles, and wonderful gifts under our belts over the last seven years (oh my god has it been seven years??) we’ve now been returning home to Afrikaburn. This project is in the experienced hands of a little collection of people who care deeply about the burn, and would love to work with you to give it that extra tropical twist this year!

We ain’t shy... if you want to know more, all you have to do is ask!

So what exactly is O-Hey-Sis!...

Well firstly… It’ll… Well. It will be built upon a 3.5 ton truck. Yes you heard that right! A steel substructure will be built over the existing chassis which will provide support the wooden platform, out of which soaring palm trees will rise and in turn supporting the upper decks. But HEY!.. you don't care how we make it right? You just want us to do it already! (subject to all mandatory health and safety checks of course)

O-Hey-Sis! will also be more than a rolling Oasis in the desert (which I think we’d already be cool with to be honest). It will have misters to spray cool water over its dwellers. It will have flamethrowers coming out of the top of the palm trees at night. No matter the weather, the O-Hey-Sis! has got you covered.

And you know it’s not a party without a signature drink - and we will be brewing our very own mystical beverage just for our comfortable guests... We will call it the O-Hey-Sis-Bru! QUIVER BEFORE ITS PERCENTAGE ALCOHOL CONTENT!!

Of course, we all love a little (read: constant) music in our lives and so we are setting our goals high. We are aiming to get a great sound system we can set up onboard and blow some minds at night with tropical music classics in the desert. If you are a DJ and are keen to DJ... or have a sound system *hint hint, nudge nudge* then please get in touch. Aside from our infinite gratefulness and love – campmate Keir will imprint emotionally on you and essentially do your every bidding. Treat him kindly you silver-eared devil. What is needed...

What is needed?

Well... What isn't... We have applied for an art grant from Afrikaburn through which we are sure to get some bucks. The diverse group of broke people you saw above are lifting those couch cushions and checking all jean pockets before they go into the wash for every cent in the hopes of contributing $600 toward our tropical dream. As much as we wish we could reach our target all by our lonesome, the reality is simply that we’re going to need a bit more help.

Our grand total to make this project a reality is $5,200 which leaves an additional $4,600 that needs to be raised for our [and hopefully your] floating jungle to become a reality.

Where is your contribution going?

The main costs and bulk of our budget will be going towards:

- buying the 3.5 ton vehicle and doing the necessary modifications and repairs to the vehicle

- buying all the wood for the various platforms, railings, structure, trees, etc

- buying all the steel which forms a large part of substructure and strength

Besides the large costs, there are many smaller costs often overlooked. These include things such as bolts, screws, fabric, paint, varnish, cutting discs, sandpaper, grinding discs, welding rods, and many others.

Of course then there is the question... where and do we make this? To make it we need the use of a workshop, tools, storage and all of those additionals. 

Want to help but can't splurge right now?

Firstly if you haven't already you can share our campaign far and wide to help us reach those far reaching places...

- If you are in Cape Town and have materials, decor or anything island and tropical please get in touch and we will gladly relieve you of your unwanted items.

- Live in Cape Town and keen to get involved? Help with the actual build is definitely welcome. Or if you have no clue what a no.6 spanner is and just want a good chat while drinking beer and watching other people work... Well that can be arranged too!

- If you have contacts for sound equipment or DJ's then please, put them in contact with us. We welcome all suggestions and ideas.

- If you have contacts for sound equipment or DJ's then please, put them in contact with us. We welcome all suggestions and ideas.

story:
We are The Department of Illumination: a non-profit arts organization that has been bringing joy and creativity to Prince Edward County since 2013.

On November 9, 2019, we will celebrate our 7th annual Firelight Lantern Festival, a magical event which has become a much-loved community tradition. Hundreds of people meet in Benson Park clutching their homemade lanterns; together we parade down Main Street to the Crystal Palace, where we're delighted by live music, performances, and art installations. In the weeks prior to the festival we are offering FREE lantern-making workshops as well as a costuming workshop to help you get festival-ready!

Despite our brilliant track record of bringing high-quality accessible arts programming to our community, we were not awarded one of our grants this year; it's a tough time to be a non-profit organization in this province. But we're not giving up, because we know you love us as much as we love you! Together we can make it happen!

Please consider making a donation today - it takes a village to raise a festival!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $8000 to cover some of our basic expenses.  The great news is that we have tons of fantastic perks that you can get in exchange for your donation. Seriously, check out the list!

Perks will be available for pick-up at Small Pond Arts just outside Picton or at one of our lantern-making workshops (Picton, Bloomfield, Wellington, Cherry Valley). 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Signal boost! Share this campaign.
  • Donate a perk. As perks start running out, we'll add more!

Thank you for your support!

story:
An Unlikely Evolution

The name Nonsensico originated around 5 years ago. At first, it was used to describe an obscure line of buttons (sold out of a gumball machine) that featured visual non sequiturs that I found amusing. Perfect Toast, Tiny Monkey, Foot In Space, etc. An edition of 200 or so was produced for each, and when they sold out it was on to the next one. It was (and continues to be) so amusing.

Over the years, the Nonsensico name was also used to describe a bunch weird stuff I was making that didn't fit anywhere. Sort of an incubator for misfit ideas. An obsession with tiny traffic cones, some photos of painted rubber feet in front of furry backgrounds, a Cheese Cult, fuzzy buttons, etc. Again, so very amusing.

All of this leads up to a couple months ago, when I was photographed in front of a wall full of unusual objects, and for some reason a fake magazine cover with the Nonsensico name was designed. Well, one cover was not enough, and a couple more popped into existence. The amusement continued, and it normally would have ended there...

A close friend and conspirator then declared he wanted to see what this magazine actually looked like, and so the game was afoot. That is when the concept pivoted a bit--instead of a magazine filled with my random nonsense, I decided (with inspiration from several folks) to make it a bona fide, carefully curated publication filled mostly with other artists and their excellently crafted nonsense. Sometimes playful, sometimes brutal, some pop, some abstract, and almost always not easy to comprehend and very subjective. Really, it should have ended there, but EVERYONE I wanted to feature said yes without reservation. It was touching for so many people to trust me with their weird babies, and it gave me motivation to keep things rolling along. So here I am with this wonderful object in hand, and I hope it amuses and/or inspires you as much as it does me. -jay

A Simple Sales Pitch

The offerings are simple--magazines and t-shirts. All copies sold through this Indiegogo campaign get a free screen print and a Cheese Cult button.

 

Duration & Fulfillment

The campaign will end March 1st, and since there is no funding threshold, fulfillment will go into motion right away regardless of how many orders were placed. A sample run of around 50 magazines has already happened, and the quality was wonderful. The same production methods will be used for the main run. The plan is to have magazines manufactured by mid March, and shipped right around March 21st. An accompanying release event will happen at Rogue Buddha gallery in Minneapolis, MN on March 21 (subject to change at this time). You should have your nonsense by the end of March.

Other Ways You Can Help

You know the drill by now--sharing this thing with others is an important part of a successful campaign. Please do whatever you can. Here's the link: https://igg.me/at/nonsensico

story:
Short Summary

Black Magic is a project created and curated by a black female artist in response to the overwhelming lack of black female and non binary representation in the fantasy genre. Very rarely are there black characters in fantastical pieces of media and if there are, they are usually a token secondary character and almost never the main characters of the story.

Black Magic has given artists an opportunity to explore the idea of having black characters be the focus in fantasy. In this book, black girls and non binary people are depicted as everything from knights, to fairies,  goddesses,  monster hunters, vampires, and tons more!

Spreading word and backing this project will help us share the message that there is a demand for diversity and poc representation in fantasy. Additionally, if this project is successfully funded, this will be a great opportunity for our contributing artists to gain exposure and recognition for their talent.

Though the main focus of this project is to promote black visibility in fantasy and to gain exposure for our contributing artists, this project also serves as an opportunity to donate to Flint, Michigan as there is still a need for aid and supplies for those who are still without clean water. After printing and shipping costs for the books and promised perk merchandise, all proceeds will be donated to the United Way of Genesee County's Flint Water Fund by Black Magic's curator and creator, Jazmine Boatman.

***Please note that this project is NOT in any way affiliated with the United Way of Genesee County or any other Flint relief effort. We are simply making a donation.***

 

What We Need

  • $3,000 covers the minimum cost (amount is rounded up in case there are any unexpected expenses) to print all the books and merchandise promised in tiered perk packages.
  •  All residual funds and additional profit made if we exceed our goal, will be donated to the United Way of Genesee County's Flint Water Fund. Information about the fund and what the money goes towards can be found HERE.

What You Get

The Impact

This project serves as a way to promote diversity (with a focus of black visibility) within the fantasy genre and to provide exposure to a talented group of black artists with varying degrees of skill, style, and experience.

  • By backing this project you are supporting the idea of artists from various groups that are underrepresented in media, creating their own content and sharing it for public consumption. 
  • If this project is fully funded, it will add to the evidence that there is a demand for more diverse media and specifically diversity within the fantasy genre.

Risks & Challenges

All of the content for the book has already been completed, costs have been accounted for, and vendors have been quoted. Everything will be sent off to the printers as soon as the campaign ends.

After printing and shipping, a donation will be made to the United Way of Genesee County's Flint Water Fund by the Black Magic Zine's curator and organizer, Jazmine Boatman. A receipt will be posted on here and on our tumblr to provide proof of donation.  Estimated Date: March 2018
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! You can direct others to our various forms of social media or link them directly to this project! 

Social Media:
Facebook
Instagram
Tumblr
Twitter

You can also easily share links to our social media via Indiegogo's sharing options!

For Press Inquiries, please contact us at blackmagiczine17@gmail.com

ARTISTS:
Alissa Sallah | Amber Huff | Anastasia Magloire | Angael Davis | Annabelle Hayford |  Arielle Daughma | Ayanna Johnson | Brianna A. Berry | Brittany Moodie | Chelsea Geter | Cleopatria Peterson | Damali Beatty | Dixie Robinson | Geneva B | Imani King | Jazmine Boatman | Jhenne Tyler |  Kamela "Mars" Heyward | Kellye Perdue | Kia | Leya | M.Cat.White | Mackenzie Walker | Mildred Louis | Munadraws | Nicole Miles | Olivia F | Olivia Stephens | Patricia Daguisan | Rooren | Sami Brice | Shauna J Grant | Sichore | Sie | Steffi Walthall | Syd Sanders | Yesenia Moises |


Book Layout: Eleanor Stevens

Video by Kenny Letelier

story:
Short Summary

Short Summary

About Me: I hold a Masters in Art Education from the Mass College of Art and Design, and a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Tufts University and the Museum School of Fine Arts. I am the owner and designer for the company B. Felt. I design and manufacture by hand, beautiful felted garments and accessories. My work can be seen in galleries and museum shops around the nation and internationally. My work and show schedule can be viewed on my web site, www.bfelt.com.

Veils Part 2. I want to thank everyone who has contributed thus far to helping to bring back the Veils to Lowell, MA.  The money that was raised has been put to good use. I have been able to hire professionals to repair the Veils and they are doing an AMAZING job. Here is a link to Part 1 https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/veils-of-col... 

I would like to give a shout out to all who have contributed to date with either money, time or both: Jane Pratt, Suzanne Bacon, M.J.Bujold, A M Katz , Richard Juknavorian, Anna Comella, Bettina Donaghy, Kelli Knack, Mary Walker, Ann Conlin, Pat McSweeney, Kathleen Bryson, Judy Narosny, Susan Blook, Paige Gayuski, Betsy Disharoon, Ellie Ramsey, and Carol Hochburg. Your support means so much to me.

I have been given two grants one from the Lowel Cultural Council distributed from the Massachusetts Cultural Council and I was awarded the UMass Govenors 2020 Challenge grant and just today I am also happy to report that Enterprise Bank has come through with a donation to help bring the monies I need to raise down to 2000.  THANK YOU Enterprise! There is still a ways to go, and not being a professional fund raiser and not overly tech savvy, I admit to failing to push and follow up on the campaign in a timely matter.

History: As the National Park boat leaves the Swamp Locks, it enters the lower Pawtucket Canal, heading into the Industrial Canyon. In 1890, if you entered this part of the canal, the crescendos of hundreds of shuttles flying back and forth on the looms would have been deafening. Now, the only sounds are from the outboard motors of the National Park’s Canal boat and the occasional quack of the ducks. Today the mills are filled with artists, entrepreneurs, established businesses, restaurants, condominiums, and apartments. As the canal boat eases through the locks, the building on the right is nothing more than architectural remnants. A ghostly facade of windows belonging to the Dye House was once a two story building and part of the Appleton Mills. It is from these windows that these dyes were unceremoniously dumped into the canals. Some days it would be a red canal, and some days it would be a yellow canal, while other days it would just look like mud.

What We Need & What You Get

I am planning on raising $4,500 for this campaign. So far I have raised $2500. With part 2 I hope to raise the rest of the monies. Contributing to this campaign will help me achieve multiple important steps in the re-installing of this piece, including but not limited to: repairing last seasons veils and creating new ones if needed, hiring an engineer to help me with the thermodynamics of the canal and installing the veils without damaging the historic building or the veils and without injury to me or to anyone else involved, 

The perks you will obtain if you contribute to this campaign are as followed;

$5 Postcard 

$15 Postcard and stickers

$30 T-shirt

$50 Postcard and a mug

$75 A tote bag

$150 a mug and a tote bag

$250 a mug tote bag and a t-shirt

$500 a t-shirt and tickets for the canal tour

$1000 Lunch with me in my loft and a personalized tour for 10 people of the canal

All of the merchandise given with the perks will be adorned with an abstract graphic of the veils. The postcard will have a photo of the veils from last season's installation.

This installation will be happening whether I meet my goal or not. If I do not reach my goal, I will be forced to pull back on the installation.

Risks & Challenges

After having done this installation before I am prepared to face the risks I faced last year, and I will be more equipped this time around. I am going to be hiring an engineer to help me with a lot of the challenges I faced, including dealing with the thermodynamics of the canal, figuring out the best solution for installing the veils on the building without damaging it as it is historic, and overcoming the 30 feet high installation on unsteady ground. Having an engineer will make the installation process go much smoother than it had in the past, therefore making me very well prepared.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this cause, please help us in another way by sharing this campaign with others through the Indiegogo sharing tools.

If you are willing to help physically, we are also looking for volunteers for the installation of this piece!

story:
Welcome to our project “Wealth in your mind” , is art for our ears with messages of analogies and metaphors that will allow you to have a different day, give a gift and shape your present and future through an unforgettable experience that shows the mirror of what we think.

We are two enterprising:  Laura, a visual arts student, who is in charge of the illustrations. And Angelica, psychologist, specialist in human management and a student of conscious shapes of human beings; her role is to write according what she sees in others, her thoughts and dreams.

We´ve been working hard for a year and a half, drawing and writing about experiences, so the contribution is now for printing. Our project is a box with 52 postcards, with analogies and metaphors and 1 that is the guide of an unforgettable experience. You can see some postcards as an example of the project below.

Our goal: US$3.500  intended for the printing of the box and the 52 postcards.  

By supporting us with :

$5 we recognize your input and you will get 1 digital postcard

$10 we will give you our gratitude and 3 digital postcards

$20 your contribution will get us closer to the impresion so we will send you 5 digital postcards

$50 we praise your participation and we will grant you 10 digital postcards

$100 we exalt your contribution so we will send you a printed copy to your country

Will be very grateful if you help us to share this campaign through facebook, twitter , email, chat etc…  

Thank you !!

Bienvenidos a nuestro proyecto Riqueza en tu mente, es arte  para nuestros oídos con mensajes de metáforas y analogías que te permitirán tener un día diferente, otorgar un obsequio, determinar que te dice el hoy y el mañana, a través de una experiencia inolvidable que conecta el espejo donde refleja lo que pensamos, llegando al subconsciente y que nos permitirá sobrepasar el dominio de lo que conocemos.

El proyecto lo estamos realizando; Laura, estudiante de artes de la Universidad Javeriana y Cofundadora, su rol es el desarrollo de las ilustraciones del proyecto y Angélica María, Psicóloga, especialista en Gestión Humana y estudiante de las formas del consciente, su rol está enfocado a escribir, de acuerdo a lo que observa de una tarde, lo que refleja el otro, a sus pensamientos y sueños de su mente subconsciente. 

Somos emprendedoras, que llevamos un año y medio, ilustrando y escribiendo sobre experiencias; actualmente la contribución es para la impresión  y una postal iluminada a fin de que conozcas nuestros logros, puesto que queremos salir a divulgar nuestras postales y que muchos seres humanos tengan la posibilidad a través de una metáfora cambiar un día sus pensamientos y construir nuevos modelos mentales que nos permitirá tener Riqueza en Nuestras Mentes.  

Qué es el proyecto : Caja de 52 postales, con Analogías y metáforas y 1 que es la guía de una experiencia inolvidable. 

Nuestra Meta : US$ 3.500 que son destinados a la impresión de las 52 postales y la caja, Nuestra gratitud por difundir nuestra campaña a través de email, facebook, twitter, chat  y contarlo a tus amigos y familiares.

Recompensa:  Con tu contribución será posible la impresión de las postales y la caja de “ Riqueza en tu mente “ 

Al apoyarnos con:

US$ 5  Reconocemos  tu aporte y obtendrás 1 Postal Digital.

US$ 10 Te otorgamos  nuestra gratitud por creer en el cambio de pensamiento, y obtendrás 3 Postales Digitales.

US$ 20 Tu Contribución, nos llevará a tener un gran acompañamiento en la impresión, por ello te enviaremos 5 Postales Digitales.

US$ 50 Elogiamos tu participacion y te concederemos 10 Postales Digitales que mas nos generó impacto al construirlas.

US$ 100 Enaltecemos tu contribución y otorgamos tú “ Ejemplar ” impreso que  llegará a tu país de destino.

And Angelica, psychologist, specialist in human management and a student of conscious shapes of human beings; her role is to write according what she sees in others, her thoughts and dreams.We´ve been working hard for a year and a half, drawing and writing about experiences, so the contribution is now for printing. Our project is a box with 52 postcards, with analogies and metaphors and 1 that is the guide of an unforgettable experience. You can see some postcards as an example of the project below.Our goal: US$3.500  intended for the printing of the box and the 52 postcards.  By supporting us with :$5 we recognize your input and you will get 1 digital postcard$10 we will give you our gratitude and 3 digital postcards$20 your contribution will get us closer to the impresion so we will send you 5 digital postcards$50 we praise your participation and we will grant you 10 digital postcards$100 we exalt your contribution so we will send you a printed copy to your countryWill be very grateful if you help us to share this campaign through facebook, twitter , email, chat etc…  Thank you !!Bienvenidos a nuestro proyecto Riqueza en tu mente, es arte  para nuestros oídos con mensajes de metáforas y analogías que te permitirán tener un día diferente, otorgar un obsequio, determinar que te dice el hoy y el mañana, a través de una experiencia inolvidable que conecta el espejo donde refleja lo que pensamos, llegando al subconsciente y que nos permitirá sobrepasar el dominio de lo que conocemos.El proyecto lo estamos realizando; Laura, estudiante de artes de la Universidad Javeriana y Cofundadora, su rol es el desarrollo de las ilustraciones del proyecto y Angélica María, Psicóloga, especialista en Gestión Humana y estudiante de las formas del consciente, su rol está enfocado a escribir, de acuerdo a lo que observa de una tarde, lo que refleja el otro, a sus pensamientos y sueños de su mente subconsciente. Somos emprendedoras, que llevamos un año y medio, ilustrando y escribiendo sobre experiencias; actualmente la contribución es para la impresión  y una postal iluminada a fin de que conozcas nuestros logros, puesto que queremos salir a divulgar nuestras postales y que muchos seres humanos tengan la posibilidad a través de una metáfora cambiar un día sus pensamientos y construir nuevos modelos mentales que nos permitirá tener Riqueza en Nuestras Mentes.  Qué es el proyecto : Caja de 52 postales, con Analogías y metáforas y 1 que es la guía de una experiencia inolvidable. Nuestra Meta : US$ 3.500 que son destinados a la impresión de las 52 postales y la caja, Nuestra gratitud por difundir nuestra campaña a través de email, facebook, twitter, chat  y contarlo a tus amigos y familiares.Recompensa:  Con tu contribución será posible la impresión de las postales y la caja de “ Riqueza en tu mente “ Al apoyarnos con:US$ 5  Reconocemos  tu aporte y obtendrás 1 Postal Digital.US$ 10 Te otorgamos  nuestra gratitud por creer en el cambio de pensamiento, y obtendrás 3 Postales Digitales.US$ 20 Tu Contribución, nos llevará a tener un gran acompañamiento en la impresión, por ello te enviaremos 5 Postales Digitales.US$ 50 Elogiamos tu participacion y te concederemos 10 Postales Digitales que mas nos generó impacto al construirlas.US$ 100 Enaltecemos tu contribución y otorgamos tú “ Ejemplar ” impreso que  llegará a tu país de destino.

story:
Project Overview

 

My name is Tatyana Ostapenko. I am a contemporary visual artist and I create history paintings that record the daily lives of people who usually don’t make it into official historical records. I use images from my native Ukraine to speak about universal human experiences and evoke empathy and hope in the face of adversity.

It’s been my dream for a long time now to paint a mural. I finally get to create a piece of public art and now you can be a part of making this dream become reality.

In the past year I have been working on an increasingly larger scale, creating life sized figurative paintings of older women from my native Ukraine. And now I get to bring my beloved babushkas out to a public space. 

This mural is a part of the Ladies Up initiative by the Portland Street Art Alliance, a small local non-profit organization.  PSAA has extended an opportunity to five local female-identifying artists to create murals in SE Portland's Buckman Neighborhood at SE Morrison and 14th Ave. I got one of the larger walls in the project, a whopping 10x18 footer. I can’t wait to paint my babushkas so they can sternly stare at the Portland passerby from this expanse!

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

For this campaign I am asking to raise $2500. This covers:

  • fair wages for hiring a fellow artist to assist with logistics, transportation and on site assistance during the painting of the mural  

  • the cost of fulfilling all the amazing rewards you crowd-funders will get to enjoy by contributing to our campaign

  • creative time for designing and painting the mural


The Portland Street Art Alliance is providing participating artists with a materials stipend of $750 which helps to cover paint, supplies and other material expenses. However, at this scope of project, I will need help. I will be hiring an assistant with a vehicle to transport paints, ladders, and other sundry to and from the location, as well as help me with wall preparation, roughing in the design, and generally keeping me sane and well-hydrated.

 

The project is going to take a week from start to completion and I want to pay my assistant a fair wage. And as I am volunteering many more hours for preparation and design, as well as physical execution of the mural, I would greatly appreciate any and all contributions to compensate for my creative time and effort for producing this piece of public art in the midst of the pandemic. 

 

To reach my fundraising campaign goal of $2500 I am offering available paintings that served as inspiration for this mural as contribution perks. They are all images of strong, resilient and much underappreciated older women. I don’t consider them portraits of particular individuals; they are collective images, archetypes, embodiments of the indomitable spirit of all of our mothers and grandmothers who withstood adversity and weathered many storms with dignity and without much praise or acknowledgement.

 

 

The original painting that I created as a mock up for this mural is available as one of the campaign perks. Own a piece of soon to be Portland history! The mural will be on that wall for 3 years, but you can keep the original scale model design forever.

This painting that serves as the mural design measures 24x36 inches. It is painted in acrylic on canvas.  It is yours when you generously contribute to this campaign at the $999 level. 

 


 

 

I will also make this painting available as high quality art prints in a limited edition of 25.

Each print will be hand numbered and signed and available as a perk for contributions of $35.

Even if I don't reach my campaign goal, all available funds will be applied toward fulfilling all perks, and paying my assistant first, with any remainder going toward my artist fees.

 

 

 

About the Artist 

 

I was born in the Soviet Union, and lived half of my life in the US.  Even though I have always wanted to be an artist, I took time to allow myself this luxury.

I worked as a stock trader, car auction buyer, bartender and Russian-English interpreter before going back to school for art. And it's been only a year since I've been a full time artist.

I have exhibited my work at international art fairs and museums in South Korea, Ukraine and the United States. Along the way, I’ve been fortunate enough to sell to private and corporate collectors and governmental institutions alike.

Dear parents, don’t be afraid of letting your kids go to art school! My first degree was in business and I carried pretty much no practical and applicable skills into the world from it. Art school taught me executive level problem solving and a can-do attitude that empowered me to tackle projects from designing and installing custom flooring in my house to teaching myself tech and marketing skills. The main thing that art school teaches nowadays are creative problem solving skills and ability to approach challenges with a can do attitude. Now, these are serious transferable skill applicable in life and business for sure! 

 

 

 

The Impact

 

The vast majority of the images of women we see tend to be the same: young, slender, conforming to particular commercial ideas and ideals of beauty and femininity. In my paintings, and now on a large scale public mural, I show women that are strong and resilient, who stand tall and whose primary concern isn't the smooth perfection of their looks. We need more diverse representation of women in our environments. Age isn’t something to hide and apologize for. These babushkas will remind the passerby of that!

 


 

 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

     

    If you are unable to contribute financially today, you can support this project by sharing the heck out of it on your social media and with friends! 

    Thank you so much 
    I am incredibly grateful for your belief, trust, and support of my vision and ability to make this project a reality. Thank you!

story:
WELCOME TO THE AZYLUM

 

Pronounced – 'Ṭḧę Aⱬýlūɯ'

–If you flirt long enough with madness, madness will start flirting back

 

❤️  Thanks for the hearts and funding the dream ❤️

Link to Dream

We are making this campaign to raise a little extra funds for buying props, decorations and expanding Thę Azýlūm experience. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for €800, but the campaign is 'flexible' meaning we get what we raise. All funds go towards building the experience with props for us and people being admitted to Thę Azýlūm.

Thę Azýlūm consists of several smaller rooms and areas that will be furnished and themed:

– The Waiting Room

 – The Reception

 – The Hallway

 – The Doctors Office

When you admit yourself to an insane asylum, it's important to really feel hospitalized. So in order to make sure all patients, doctors, surgeons, next of kin and random drop-bys feel at home,  we will be getting things like:

Stethoscope, Lab coats, Patient shirts/coats, Bloody bodyparts, Hairnets, Straitjacket, Office stuff

And things like:

Fake blood,  Medicin jars, Posters of medical stuff, Anatomical skeleton, Info-mercial TV

Your support will be rewarded with extraordinary rewards, so make sure to check out the perks. Find what suits you and we will be looking forward to hospitalizing you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stuff: If you have stuff that fits the theme and the project, we would be happy to receive it. It could be anything from a camping chair, a shrubbery, a diagnosis or perhaps even something for the wardrobe. 

Events: If you want to participate and bring a happening of your own, you are more than welcome. Just let us know.

Sharing: Spread the word to your friends or fellow maddies

 

STOP CRYING!

story:
2017 Kalham Sutra Calendar

Indian Goddess, Nude Fine Art 

The calendar Kalham Sutra will feature stunning topless nude art photos of Indian Goddess Kalham Amor in nature by Sean Pozin of Gypsy Vibes Art. We estimate that production, marketing & photoshoot travel expenses will cost around $2,000 so we need your help to make our dream come true by backing the 2017 Kalham Sutra calendar campaign! 

Kalham Sutra is inspired by the Sanskrit Kama Sutra which is an ancient guide to love, sensuous & sensual pleasure. Kalham Sutra touches on an aspect of Indian culture that is practically ignored in this century, which is art with sensual tones that embraces the body for what it is in its natural state. The book will make more people realize that the world of photography and modeling is more about creating art that is centered around larger issues than just taking sexy photographs. 

About Kalham Amor

Kalham Amor is a glamour model of Indian descent based in Dallas, TX. Kalham always had a dream to model and is one of the very few open-minded glamour models of Indian descent who also comes from a conservative background. Kalham is a gorgeous model who has been published in many magazines & she also wrote her first book "The Book of Amor" at the age of 21. 

About Sean Pozin

www.Instagram.com/GypsyVibesArt

Sean Pozin is a rising star in the nude art photography world & has been involved in the arts for over 10 years from oil painting, photography, graphic design, art gallery installations to ceramics on the wheel. Sean only recently picked up a camera 14 months ago & is driven by passion to create beautiful nude art in nature that connects with the soul. As a photographer Sean strives to capture a models emotions, spark the creative spirit & showcase the beauty of mother nature.

"Love, consciousness, and creativity are the highest refinements of the cosmic evolutionary force." ~ Alex Grey

Where Will Funds Go?

Travel expenses: since Kalham is based in Dallas, TX, she will have to travel to Florida to create the photographs and she will also need a place to stay. This alone should cost about $600 to pay for flight tickets and a hotel room.

Designing, printing, and shipping costs: after the project is finished, all of the books will have to be designed, printed, and shipped to the contributors. High quality printing and shipping are not cheap so it should cost at least $600, if not more, to get all of the books to the contributors in a timely fashion.

Each and every contribution is valuable to us because without your support, none of this would be possible. To reward contributors, each contributor will receive an exclusive reward. 

Why Your Contribution Matters?

By contributing to this campaign you will be able to help Sean Pozin & Kalham Amor break the stereotype that people place on Indian culture plus create awareness about Indian mythological art. Kalham Sutra will help more people all over the world realize that there are women of Indian descent such as Kalham Amor who fully understand the meaning of the phrase "my body, my choice" and that clothes, or lack thereof, do not define a woman.

We Love Your Support!

Please help us by sharing the project as much as possible. We are humbled and grateful for your support because this project would not be possible without you!!

Twitter

Instagram

Snapchat

Facebook 

IndieGoGo share tools too!

story:
About Unísono Festival

Unísono is a FREE fiesta that celebrates art, music, diversity and community engagement in Chicago's Historic and Unique Pilsen neighborhood. Unísono, Spanish for unison, brings ALL people together.  Now in its fourth year, Unísono is a unique festival because it combines food, dance, music and art with social causes.

More than a street festival, more than a community fair, Unísono 2014 will showcase local, national and international chefs, artists and musicians. Each festival has a social justice theme and Unísono 2014 will focus on health and wellness.

Unísono has invited dancers, nutritionists, yogis, acupuncturists, healers, doctors, trainers and other experts to teach and share. Unisono 2014 brings workshops, instruction, yoga (ALL day!) and invites all to come and engage!

Unísono Festival  brings long time residents, new neighbors, young and old together and invites them to unite with great food and music. In past years Unísono has featured Grammy award winning groups like Sones de Mexico and Grupo Fantasma and cutting edge Chicago indi rockers. Traditional Mexican folk artists shared the stage with dub step dj’s. And it works beautifully.

As important as the terrific musical line up is the community engagement that happens at Unísono. Each year’s event has a social justice theme that brings educators, thinkers and doers to share knowledge and ideas. Workshops and panel discussions at a music and arts festival? Yep. Unísono: Unison: A cacophony of voices, sounds, and ideas coming together as one.

 Unísono Festival is free thanks to the support from people like you! Putting the fun in fundraising, we have been gearing up for this year's festival... since last year's festival. Did you join us for the Cinco de Mayo Tequila Cantina Crawl? Were you with us at the Gwen la Roka comedy show? Thank you! We are SO Grateful for your support. We are now SO CLOSE to our fundraising goal to bring you the Unisono 2014 Festival that Pilsen deserves. 

Unísono 2014 Campaign

With your help, Unisono 2014 will have the same unique artistic performances and presentations as in years past, with added panel discussions and workshops. With this year's Health and Wellness theme we are planning some dynamic events and activities. Your contributions and support will ensure that the 2014 Unísono Festival engages with a stellar lineup of music, art, food, celebration, learning, activity and community.

How to Help

•  We are seeking $7000 for Unisono 2014. This is the last piece! Your support means a great deal to us, and we want to show our appreciation for your support. There are awesome unique perks associated with the various levels of support available. Any and all support is much appreciated!!

Your financial backing is much needed and appreciated. Please share our campaign with your friends and family, and connect with us on our website and social media assets. We love to hear from fans and supporters. Most importantly, come join us at Unísono 2014!

www.unisonofestival.org

Follow us on facebook and share our page:

https://www.facebook.com/unisonofestival?focus_composer=true&ref_type=bookmark

Please use Indiegogo Share tools to further support our cause.

We thank you greatly for your support, time and engagement!

Unísono Team

story:
I am raising money for a set of Copic markers. I have been creating a series of pen and ink drawings with awesome color thanks to a set of Copic markers I was lucky enough to borrow from my friend's Taylor and Kyle. In addition to the pen and ink drawings I have also begun illustrating a short children's book and the illustrations require copic markers to reach the finishline! Thanks for any and all support you can give!

PS: The photo above is part of a drawing that I will be making prints of and including in your Perks!
story_txt: I am raising money for a set of Copic markers. I have been creating a series of pen and ink drawings with awesome color thanks to a set of Copic markers I was lucky enough to borrow from my friend's Taylor and Kyle. In addition to the pen and ink drawings I have also begun illustrating a short children's book and the illustrations require copic markers to reach the finishline! Thanks for any and all support you can give!PS: The photo above is part of a drawing that I will be making prints of and including in your Perks!

story:
Project Dispatch is a mail order artwork subscription service that was started in 2009 with the idea of creating a space for artists to get exposure and sell their work, as well as a place for collectors to begin acquiring artwork and engaging directly with the artists they are collecting.

Our subscriptions range from $30 per month to $90 per month, customizable for durations of 3, 6, or 12 months. We currently have 23 artist members, and subscribers can receive original artwork from the artist of their choice each month, or be surprised by a new artist with each installment. These works are shipped directly from the artist's studio to your door! 

One of the most important aspects of Project Dispatch is to provide an affordable option for collecting art. BUT we also need to make sure that it sustains the artists involved. Project Dispatch only takes 25% of art sales, paying 75% of our revenue to artists. This leaves very little for our operating expenses, but we believe that artists should get paid for their art above all else. 

We are already interacting with a variety of retail venues and galleries, but we need to take it to the next level with promotion and advertising to reach a broader base of new collectors. We have big plans for a marketing strategy with Hyperallergic Media and PRX that will encourage revenue that will sustain and grow and business. 

Please help us, so that we can continue to bring you artwork in the form of monthly subscriptions and connect you with the local artists whose careers you are helping form!  

WHAT WE NEED

Our goal for this project is to raise $11,000 to cover the costs of design for our online advertising campaign, radio sponsorships with podcasts on art, design, and cultural interest, as well as payment to artists, shipping, and production costs for the awesome perks that we are offering as a thank you for your support. These perks include original artwork, opportunities to meet with artists one on one in their studios, opportunities to select works from our flat file for your personal collection, tote bags, private parties and more!

THE BREAKDOWN:

PRX CAMPAIGN - $6,000  

This quote includes:

·  3 featured sponsor spots on Michael Ian Black's "HOW TO BE AMAZING" podcast for $600 each

·  2 featured sponsor spots on "FUGITIVE WAVES" podcast for $800 each

·  1 featured sponsor spot on "THE TRUTH" podcast for $2,600.

These podcasts have between 20,000, 40,000 and 130,000 average downloads per episode respectively. This campaign will allow us to reach approximately 270,000 prospective subscribers!

HYPERALLERGIC MEDIA CAMPAIGN - $2,800

This quote is for a campaign specific to the Art & Design Podcasts through Hyperallergic including: Colossal, 99% Invisible, Spoon and Tamago, and Vandalog. This will give us a banner ad on the top of the sidebar for 2 weeks, guaranteeing over 200,000 impressions!

Design for Hyperallergic Media online advertisement - $500

Estimated cost of offered perks, payment to artists, and shipping - $1,700

TOTAL = $11,000


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Help us spread the word about our campaign by:

Directing people to our fundraising page: https://www.indiegogo.com/at/projectdispatchmedia

Sharing information about our campaign and following us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Project-Dispatch/144285334913

Subscribing to Project Dispatch on our website: www.projectdispatch.com


THANK YOU!  THANK YOU!  THANK YOU!
