story_txt:
What it's for:
I'm a visual artist working with photography and organic processes. I and am hungry to learn and develop my practise. 
Thanks to your generous support so far, I have been able to attend the photography course at Dartmoor Arts Summer School, the content of which built on the concerns and approaches that I explore as part of my practise. It has been a phenomenal experience full of learning, inspiration and confidence building.I now need your help to reach the target so that I can pay off the balance for the course.
More about the course:Photo Work : 5 Approaches to Contemporary Photography at Dartmoor ArtsFive different approaches to photographic image making over the course of five days by five different practitioners, each known for their work in a particular area of contemporary art photography.The course explored how these approaches to working within a natural environment parallel developments in the history of photography, from the early explorations of Fox Talbot and Anna Aitkins with cyanotypes and direct sun print methods, through to the opening up of space with pinhole and lens based cameras and camera obscuras, to a focus on place, the observation of natural phenomena and projection of memory and internal narratives that form the content of much contemporary photography.The course program began with an introduction by Susan Derges, and included 5 extraordinary days of workshops by 5 experts in their fields: Liz Nicol: cyanotypesSian Bonnell: pinholeTom Hunter: a performative approach with large format pinholeJem Southam: a painterly approach with large format (and ladder) Chrystel Lebas: twilight photographyThe evenings included talks, debates, performance and meeting amazing peopleI WILL BE WRITING MORE ABOUT THE EXPERIENCE ON MY BLOG!Where will the money go:

540: Cost of the course including material £540 

£20: Portfolio review with Susan Derges

£80: Travel

£105: Bunk accommodation

£150: post course production cost
£26: (estimate to make it a nice looking £1001 for Indiegogo Fees)

story:
A thrilling opportunity to go to the Terni Festival!

Last year, you helped me raise money to go to Banff and that residency was a life-changing experience! I can't thank you enough! The research I began at Banff has fed my work this entire year and is influencing my ideas for Terni. At this point, I've been invited to attend this year's festival with an eye to future collaboration.

This is a really big deal!!! This is my first invitation to a European festival outside of the UK and I'm hoping it will lead to many more European opportunities.

http://www.ternifestival.it/?p=2069

What I Need & What You Get

The Terni Festival is providing my accommodation, however, I need to get there :)

So, my dear friends & supporters, I'm asking you to please help me raise $1300 to cover the cost of airfare ($1200 Toronto to Rome) plus train travel to Terni ($100). I'll be covering all other costs (food, ground transportation, research materials).

As a thank you, I will create individualized Italian love videos for all donations of $100 or more. Book them now & it will be ready by Christmas for you to give to your loved ones (or a special treat for yourself).

ALSO! Please note that the Dinner perk ($250) is for two. I tried to edit the perk but it was too late to do so...

The Impact

I first met the Artistic Director several years ago and we talked about other artists. Now is my chance to go as an artist myself! 

My career is based on calculated risk. Each time I have taken the chance to follow up on a presenter's interest in me by demonstrating my interest in them by showing up at their festival - it's had positive results. My most recent example is my inclusion in this year's Expermentica (Cardiff, Wales) which developed out of a similar reconnaissance trip such as this one to Italy. 

How You Can Help

$10 or $20 is great! But hey, I know when finances are tight even that can be too much. If you'd still like to help, you can! Please spread the word to people you think might appreciate my work and might appreciate the struggle of the freelance artist. Facebook, twitter, and whatever else is out there that I don't even know about...

Any encouragement is very welcome!

Thank you so much,

xo Cathy

story:
About Me.....

     I am a midwesterner, born and raised, who finished art school back home, and decided to move to Boston about five years ago.  In that time, I've found the art scene here to be a bit lackluster, and am campaigning to do some big exciting creative things.  With this campaign, I hope to inspire others and bring more vitality and color to an art scene that could use a good shot in the arm!

What We Need & What You Get

    Ideally, we are trying to raise $3,000 to buy some new art pieces that are striking and bold, yet classy and marketable all at the same time.  The proceeds from these sales will just go back into the Boston art scene, to help sustain the beautiful and creative minds that support it nowadays.

     Should we not reach our goal, whatever we do raise will go toward the same initiative to help even just with beginning the funding, a "jumpstart" if you will.

If you can't donate.......

      Please feel free to link our Indiegogo site to any of your friends and family on social media or thru email.  Every little bit counts, and we're looking forward to doing some big things with the help of all of you.  Thanks guys!

story:
Welcome to the Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber Project! 

I’m Rudy Shepherd, an artist based in New York City.  My work explores the nature of evil through the mediums of painting, drawing and sculpture. This exploration involves investigations into the lives of criminals and victims of crime. I explore the complexity of these stories and the grey areas between innocence and guilt in a series of paintings and drawings of both the criminals and the victims, making no visual distinctions between the two. Going along with these portraits is a series of sculptures called the Black Rock Negative Energy Absorbers.  I have made many of these over the years, the first of which was a 24 ft tall sculpture that was installed at the Socrates Sculpture Park in Long Island City, NY in 2006. They are a group of sculptures meant to remove negative energy from people, allowing them to respond to life with the more positive aspects of their personality.

I have been given an amazing opportunity to create a 10 foot tall Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber at First Green Park, which is located on the corner of 2nd Avenue and East Houston street, right across the street from Whole Foods.  It is a prime location that gets a lot of foot traffic and is a great opportunity for me to engage with an audience of people from all walks of life many of whom may never set foot in a gallery.

The Impact

The Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber (BRNEA) will be built on site beginning on May 5, 2014 by myself and a few intrepid volunteers.

The sculpture will remain on the site for six months with the possibility of an extension of another six months.

During this time the sculpture will be pulling negative energy from passersby, grounding it into the earth and leaving people lighter and freer than they were before their contact with the BRNEA.

Six months should be enough time to see a significant decrease in the crime rate and prescription rate of anti-depressants.

There will be an unveiling ceremony on Saturday, May 31st at which the Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber will be charged up and activated. 

There will also be an internment ceremony, which no one will be invited to, where the sculpture will be destroyed and the negative energy dispersed.

What I Need

Construction Materials and other expenses - $8,500.00

·  2 x 4's and dimensional lumber

·  steel lathe

·  concrete and concrete dye

·  amethyst crystals

·  rental of a cement mixer, wheel barrel, scaffolding

·  demolition and removal expenses

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to contribute but are interested in supporting this project, I invite you to contact me about volunteering for the construction or demolition of the sculpture.

Or, you could pass this page along to your wealthier friends and get them to contribute.

Whether you contribute or not, I hope you will all come to see the Black Rock Negative Energy Absorber and enjoy its redemptive powers.

story:
I would like to produce 500 t-shirts with cool graphic and words as shown in the picture of this campaign, to give away for free to 500 coolest people I will meet at the "Bangkok Shut Down 2014 Event" which will be held on Ratchadamnern Road, the most beautiful historical road in Bangkok, Thailand.

This very special political event is created and joined by million of people in Thailand who want to tell the government that they can't stay calm with the bad politicians who're still working for the country right now. The biggest amount of people ever will all come down to march on the historical road in the old town of Bangkok to show the world their dreams for the better day... for their beloved country :)

This is surely not a violent activity. But it will feel like a festival that Thai people from everywhere come together to use their rights to ask for a CHANGE!

Your support to make this happen will be highly appreciated.

story:
I am just a poor college kid and I like drawing pictures for people. 


There are several different types of drawing you can get! 
1. Black and White/Monochrome! - $10
- a solid colour drawing! 
2. Colour! - $20
- a full colour drawing! 
3. Digital Painting! - $50
- A digital painting of whatever. WOO!
4. LINE SKETCH! -$5
- Line drawing without shading or colour. 


Additional person is $5. 

Before paying for a commission, please email me at Leahsamuels5@gmail.com so that we can discuss what you want! Just in case. 
Please make sure that the reference pictures aren't very blurry. Do not send me a black and white picture if you want it in colour, or send me a reference of colours along with the black and white picture. Thanks!
 
THESE ARE DIGITAL FILES. I will be drawing them digitally. I will not be printing them out and sending to them, but I will send the file to you via email or facebook or tumblr or whatever you like most. 

YOU ARE THE BEST!

story:
The Kidz Peace Team Anti Violence Art Shows purpose is to provide children with pro social skills, anger management skills and anti-bullying techniques. We promote community involvement through visual arts, poetry and music.

Our children spend countless hours utilizing their free-time to work on projects that will help promote peace in our schools and in our communities. Your support in our " Kidz Peace Team" program will be greatly needed and appreciated!

The Anti Violence Art Group Revolutions Timeline

June 5, 2011 The 1st " Homicide is Suicide" Anti Violence Art Show at Center City Galleries, Paterson NJ

November 4, 2011 " Homicide is Suicide" Anti Violence Art Show at The Red Door Gallery in Passaic, NJ

November 29, 2011 Anti Violence V.I.P. Day- Art Show at Westside High School in Newark, NJ

May 31, 2012 Kidz Peace Team PPS #29 Peace Rally, Paterson, NJ

June 9, 2012 " Homicide is Suicide" Anti Violence Art Show at Center City Galleries in Paterson, NJ

August 7, 2012 National Night Kidz Peace Team Peace Rally

October 27, 2012 Rutgers African American Alumni  Anti Violence Art Show at the Red Lion Cafe, College Ave Campus, New Brunswick, NJ

February 7, 2013 Death By Design Documentary Premiere at the Fabian Theater, Center City Mall, Paterson NJ

June 4, 2013 Kidz Peace Team PPS# 29 Day of Peace Anti Violence Art Show and Peace Rally

August 16, 2013 Paterson Recreation Kidz Peace Team Peace Rally, sponsored by Benjie Wimberly ( Assemblyman of the 35th District ) at Eastside Park, Paterson, NJ

Awards

March 30, 2013 National Action Network Man of Vision Award, Astoria Manor Banquet Hall, Astoria, NY

January 19, 2014 The Community Development Corporation and Paterson Youth Council Dr. Martin Luther King Dream Award

The Event 

We want to expand our Kidz Anti Violence Art Show and include all children from grades 2-5 in the entire Passaic County. We also want to include the peace rally and concert so the children have a whole day of promoting peace. There will be gift card prizes, free t-shirts, food, trivia games, anti bullying videos and fun for all but we need your help. ( tentative date May 10, 2014)

The Adult Event

Prior to the Kidz Anti Violence Art Show, there will be an adult night which is the fundraiser night. This night will be a wine tasting event. There will be live concerts, movie and video viewings and most importantly you will get to vote on your favorite art work done by the children of Passaic County. ( tentative date May 9, 2014)

Our goal  of $5800 is very conservative; it's just enough to have the events. The more we raise the bigger the event will be!

story:
Every contributor of $15 or more will receive their name in wire.

Hello folks,
I am having a rather bad year. I lost my father and my job on the same day back in April. I've been unemployed since then and it's not for lack of trying to find work. I wrecked my car last month and I can't afford a replacement. And, as you may know, unemployment benefits will come to an end on the 28th of December.

But there is a way you can help!

By contributing to my campaign you not only help an honest man get back on his feet, but you are also helping me start a business helping the elderly learn basic computer skills.
My business will involve teaching basic skills for Windows computers and Android devices (smartphones and tablets)
If I receive enough funding I will be setting up free classes for elders in need of basic computer skills tutoring.
Some of the things I will be teaching:
  • Saving and opening documents and pictures.
  • Using Facebook.
  • Sending and receiving email.
  • Adding screens and icons to android.
  • Downloading apps.
  • Much much more.
P.S. If you live in the Portland, OR metro area, I am available for private tutoring at a very reasonable hourly rate. Email me @ angel15791579@hotmail.com
story_txt:
Every contributor of $15 or more will receive their name in wire.Hello folks,I am having a rather bad year. I lost my father and my job on the same day back in April. I've been unemployed since then and it's not for lack of trying to find work. I wrecked my car last month and I can't afford a replacement. And, as you may know, unemployment benefits will come to an end on the 28th of December.But there is a way you can help!By contributing to my campaign you not only help an honest man get back on his feet, but you are also helping me start a business helping the elderly learn basic computer skills.My business will involve teaching basic skills for Windows computers and Android devices (smartphones and tablets)If I receive enough funding I will be setting up free classes for elders in need of basic computer skills tutoring.Some of the things I will be teaching:
Saving and opening documents and pictures.
Using Facebook.
Sending and receiving email.
Adding screens and icons to android.
Downloading apps.
Much much more.

P.S. If you live in the Portland, OR metro area, I am available for private tutoring at a very reasonable hourly rate. Email me @ angel15791579@hotmail.com

story:
Who is Jesse Barron?

If you don't know who Jesse Barron is, you should! He's the best. Jesse plays baseball for the Perth Heat of the Australian Baseball League. Jesse is set to be Perth's next big thing, both as a baseballer and a Perthonality. 

What do we need money for?

Jesse has a great face. It needs to be put on a pedestal around Perth. Our plan is to get over 1000 sticker's of Jesse's face and post them on visible, permanent object's around Perth. We're talking about Jesse's face on all the important Perth landmarks like the Scotto toilets, that weird pillar in the middle of the Amps dancefloor, on the Bell Tower, pasted all over Aristos' shit restaurant in Rottnest, Ben Cousins childhood house and Basil Zempilas' current house.

The sticker will be of the above animated Jesse Barron face and will be approx 12cm high by 6 cm wide.

How much do we need?

The Indiegogo fund raising minimum is $500. We can get 1000 stickers for about $400. If we raise more than $400, the excess will go to getting more stickers and also for stamps and envelopes so we can send you stickers. The more money we raise, the more stickers we get, the more little Jesse Barron faces plastered around Perth.

Perks for donating

Jesse will love you no matter how much you donate.

To encourage larger donations, the Jesse Barron Fan Club has worked with Jesse Barron himself to bring you some awesome perks. You can see them in the text box on the right.

What else can you do to help our 'Make Jesse Barron a Perthonality' cause?

Donating a little bit of coin would be great. If money is tight, drink one less pint this Saturday and donate that money instead. Future drunk you will smile when you see Jesse Barron's face all over Northbridge/Leederville/Mt Lawley etc.

Other ways to build hype about the Jesse Barron machine include dropping his name into everyday conversation's, sharing this Indiegogo page and our facebook page (www.facebook.com/jessebarronfanclub) to drum up more support and watching Jesse play at Barbagallo Ballpark whilst wearing a fake beard.

Thank you for your support. Keep Australia beard-iful

story:
للنهر ضفتان

.منصة فنية تتناول المسافة المتنامية بين الفنانين المقيمين على ضفتي نهر الاردن
(انتقل للاسفل للغة العربية)

Who are we?

We are three friends who work in the arts, from both Jordan and Palestine. We actually became friends over long discussions on why Palestinians do not stay in Amman more often to get to know the place, and how difficult it is for Jordanians to visit Palestine. One thing led to another, and we came up with 'The River Has Two Banks' - a curatorial platform that allows us to facilitate exchange and communication between Jordanian and Palestinian artists, writers, thinkers and travelers. 

Shuruq Harb is a visual artist, curator and writer based in Ramallah, Palestine. She is the co-founder of ArtTerritories, an online publishing platform on art and visual culture from the Arab world. Samah Hijawi is a visual artist, curator, writer and part of the Makan collective based in Jordan. Toleen Touq is an independent cultural operator based in Amman, who curates and programs multi-disciplinary exhibitions, festivals and workshops.


Why are we doing this?

We started 'The River Has Two Banks' in 2012. The program ran over a three-month period and spanned geographical locations from Ramallah and Bierzeit to Amman and the Jordan Valley. We invited artists who were looking at the historical and contemporary relationships of Jordan and Palestine with a critical eye, through film, music, research, and text-based works. We organized a hike to the River Jordan in an unsuccessful attempt to challenge the notion that the river is not accessible – but its true! You cannot get to the river unless you are being baptized.

We got a lot of feedback on the importance of our project: working on bridging  the relationship between two people who are so close geographically, socially and culturally - yet segregated politically. The project created encounters for people to engage and exchange professionally, and make new friendships.

By supporting the continuation of our programming into 2013 and 2014, you are helping in creating radical new ways for the creatives of the region to meet!


Past artists we've hosted

So far, we have hosted and/or collaborated with artists Noor Abed, Tarek Abu Kweik (El Fer3i), Joseph Audeh, Sandi Hilal, Bashar Humeid, Saba Innab, Annemarie Jacir, Khaled Jarrar, Dalia Kury, Sandra Madi, Clemens Messerschmidt, Oraib Toukan, Eileen Simpson and Ben White, Mohannad Yacubi and Ahmad Zatari.

You can see a list of all our past events and these contributions on our website, and you can read a review of last year’s program on Jadaliyya.

Photo from Annemarie Jacir's piece '(Re)searching When I saw You'

Mohannad Yacubi presenting his work 'Searching for Godard' in Makan.


El Fer3i performing in Bierzeit, Palestine.


What We Need 

We need to crowd fund $2000. 

The money we need will be spent as follows:

·  Travel costs and fees for 4 artists to move from Palestine to Jordan or vice versa and present their work to new audiences.

·  Translation costs in order to be able to publish all our texts in both English and Arabic.

·  Facebook ads to promote our events

We already have accommodation sorted for artists in both Amman and Ramallah through the kind sponsorship of local Bed and Breakfasts.


What You'll Get From Us

Aside from our eternal gratitude, we're offering the following cool perks! 

$10 - A shout-out on our Facebook page thanking you for your support.

$25 - The above, plus a personalized and signed postcard featuring our great design, signed by the curators. 

$100 – All of the above, plus a mention as one of our supporters on our website.

$500 – All of the above, plus a surprising 3-course dinner cooked by us, featuring the best Mediterranean dishes. We'll also invite one or two of the artists we previously worked with. You only have to make your way to Amman or Ramallah. We could also meet somewhere else when one of us is traveling somewhere in the world! 

If we don't reach our funding target, we will make do with what we have. We'll continue working, but perhaps reduce the number of events accordingly.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, don't despair! We would love it if you can spread the word as much as you can about our campaign. So please, share, share share.

Many thanks from all of us!

Photo from the hike we organized attempting to reach the shores of the River Jordan in November 2012.
Campaign image of Allenby Bridge Crossing at Jordanian-Palestinian border courtesy US Library of Congress.

 

من نحن؟

نحن مجموعة مكوّنة من ثلاث صديقات يعملن في الفنون من الأردن وفلسطين. نستطيع القول أن صداقتنا نشأت بعد نقاشات طويلة حول السبب الذي يحول دون مجيء الفلسطينيين إلى عمّان بشكل أكبر، وبقائهم فيها لمدة أطول حتى يتسنّى لهم معرفة المكان، وحول صعوبة زيارة الأردنيين لفلسطين. ومن نقاش إلى آخر، خرجنا بفكرة "للنهر ضفتان"، وهي منصة تفاعليّة تنظيميّة تمكّننا من تيسير التبادل والتواصل بين الفنانين الأردنيين والفلسطينيين، والكتّاب، والمفكّرين والرحّالة. 

شروق حرب هي فنانة بصريّة، ومُيسّرة وكاتبة تعيش في رام الله بفلسطين. وهي من المؤسسين لمبادرة "Art Territories" التي تعد منصة الكترونيّة لنشر المحتوى حول الفن والثقافة البصريّة في العالم العربي. أما سماح حجاوي فهي فنانة بصرية، ومُيسّرة وكاتبة، وجزء من فريق مكان وتقيم في عمّان. والصديقة الثالثة هي تولين توق، وهي مُيسّرة ثقافيّة مستقلة تقيم في عمّان، حيث تُيّسر وتنظّم المعارض، والمهرجانات، وورش العمل متعددة المجالات. 


لماذا نقوم بهذا العمل؟

بدأنا العمل في "للنهر ضفتان" في عام 2012. وعلى مدار ثلاثة شهور، انتشر عمل البرنامج في مواقع جغرافيّة متعددة من رام الله وبير زيت إلى عمّان وغور الأردن. قُمنا بدعوة فنانين يبحثون في العلاقات التاريخيّة والمعاصرة بين الأردن وفلسطين، ويعرضون وجهات نظر نقديّة من خلال الأفلام، والموسيقى، والبحث، والأعمال القائمة على النصوص. ونظّمنا أيضاً رحلة إلى نهر الأردن في محاولة لم يكتب لها النجاح لتحدّي الفكرة السائدة بأن الناس غير قادرين على الوصول إلى النهر، لنكتشف أنها حقيقة، إذ لا يمكنك الوصول إلى النهر إلا في حالة "التعميد".

لحسن الحظ، نحصل على الكثير من التغذية الراجعة حول أهميّة مشروعنا التي تتلخص في العمل على بناء جسور التواصل بين شعبين مترابطين جداً على المستوى الجغرافي، والاجتماعي، والثقافي، ولكنهما منفصلان سياسيّاً. ونجح المشروع في توفير الفرصة للعديد من اللقاءات ليتسنّى للناس التفاعل مع بعضهم البعض، وتبادل الخبرات على المستوى المهني، وإقامة صداقات جديدة.

من خلال دعم إكمال برامجنا حتى نهاية عام 2013 وفي عام 2014، فإنك تساعدنا في خلق طرق جديدة غير مألوفة لجمع المبدعين في المنطقة في مكان واحد.


فنانون استضفناهم في السابق

حتى اليوم، استضفنا أو تعاونّا مع فنانين كثيرين وهم: نور عبد، طارق أبو كويك (الفرعي) ، جوزف عودة، ساندي هلال، بشار حميض، صبا عنّاب، آن ماري جاسر، خالد جرّار، ساندرا ماضي، وليمانس ماسيرشميدت، عريب طوقان، إلين سيمبسون، بين وايت، مهند يعقوبي، أحمد الزعتري. 

يمكنك مشاهدة قائمة بكل الأحداث والفعاليات السابقة، والمساهمات على موقعنا الالكتروني، كما يمكنك قراءة مراجعة حول برنامج العام الفائت على موقع "جدليّة".

الصورة من مقال لآن ماري جاسر بعنوان "البحث في لما شفتك" 

مهند يعقوبي يعرض عمله "البحث عن غودارد" في مكان


"الفرعي" يقدّم عرضاً في بير زيت في فلسطين


ماذا نحتاج منكم؟

نحتاج إلى جمع 2000 $ من التبرعات الشعبيّة. وسينفق هذا المبلغ كما يلي:

- تكاليف ورسوم السفر لأربعة فنانين للانتقال من فلسطين إلى الأردن أو بالعكس، وعرض أعمالهم أمام جماهير جديدة.

- تكاليف الترجمة من أجل تمكيننا من نشر كل نصوصنا بالإنجليزيّة والعربيّة.

- إعلانات على الفيسبوك للترويج لفعالياتنا.

لقد نجنا في تأمين الإقامة للفنانين في عمّان ورام الله من خلال دعم الفنادق الصغيرة السخي.  


ما الذي تحصل عليه بعد الدعم؟

إلى جانب امتناننا لتبرعكم، نقدم لكم المكافآت التالية:

10 $ - نشكركم علنيّاً على صفحتنا على الفيسبوك على دعمكم. 

25 $ - المكافأة السابقة بالإضافة إلى بطاقة بريديّة شخصيّة من تصميم المشروع وموقعة من قبل الميسرين. 

100 $ - المكافأة السابقة بالإضافة إلى ذكر اسمكم كمؤيدين للمشروع على صفحتنا الالكترونية.   

500 $ - كل المكافأت السابقة، إلى جانب عشاء مكون من المقبلات وطبق رئيسي والحلوى، والذي نقوم نحن بطبخه وتحضيره من أشهى المأكولات من المطبخ المتوسطي. كما ندعو واحد أو اثنين من الفنانين الذين عملنا معهم في السابق، فقط عليك أن تصل إلى عمّان أو رام الله، او يمكننا أن نلتقي في مكان آخر إذا كان أي منا مسافر إلى مكان آخر في العالم.

إن لم نتمكن من الوصول إلى الهدف من التمويل، أو الحد المطلوب، سوف نكتفي بالمبلغ المتوفّر فقط. سنكمل العمل، ولكن قد نضطر إلى تقليل عدد الفعاليات لتناسب المبلغ المتوفر. 


يمكنك المساعدة بوسائل أخرى

إذا كنت لا تستطيع دعمنا مالياً، لا تفقد الأمل. نتمنى أن تساهم في نشر حملتنا قدر الإمكان، لذلك نرجو منكم مشاركة المعلومات والأخبار حول الحملة مع أصدقائكم ومعارفكم.

لكم منا جزيل الشكر.

الصورة من الرحلة التي نظمناها أملاً في الوصول إلى ضفاف نهر الأردن في شهر تشرين الثاني من العام 2012.

صورة الحملة لجسر اللنبي على الحدود الأردنية الفلسطينيّة من مكتبة الكونغرس الأميركي.

(الفرعي) ، جوزف عودة، ساندي هلال، بشار حميض، صبا عنّاب، آن ماري جاسر، خالد جرّار، ساندرا ماضي، وليمانس ماسيرشميدت، عريب طوقان، إلين سيمبسون، بين وايت، مهند يعقوبي، أحمد الزعتري. يمكنك مشاهدة قائمة بكل الأحداث والفعاليات السابقة، والمساهمات على موقعنا الالكتروني، كما يمكنك قراءة مراجعة حول برنامج العام الفائت على موقع "جدليّة".

الصورة من مقال لآن ماري جاسر بعنوان "البحث في لما شفتك" 

مهند يعقوبي يعرض عمله "البحث عن غودارد" في مكان

"الفرعي" يقدّم عرضاً في بير زيت في فلسطينماذا نحتاج منكم؟نحتاج إلى جمع 2000 $ من التبرعات الشعبيّة. وسينفق هذا المبلغ كما يلي:- تكاليف ورسوم السفر لأربعة فنانين للانتقال من فلسطين إلى الأردن أو بالعكس، وعرض أعمالهم أمام جماهير جديدة.- تكاليف الترجمة من أجل تمكيننا من نشر كل نصوصنا بالإنجليزيّة والعربيّة.- إعلانات على الفيسبوك للترويج لفعالياتنا.لقد نجنا في تأمين الإقامة للفنانين في عمّان ورام الله من خلال دعم الفنادق الصغيرة السخي.  ما الذي تحصل عليه بعد الدعم؟إلى جانب امتناننا لتبرعكم، نقدم لكم المكافآت التالية:10 $ - نشكركم علنيّاً على صفحتنا على الفيسبوك على دعمكم. 25 $ - المكافأة السابقة بالإضافة إلى بطاقة بريديّة شخصيّة من تصميم المشروع وموقعة من قبل الميسرين. 100 $ -  المكافأة السابقة بالإضافة إلى ذكر اسمكم كمؤيدين للمشروع على صفحتنا الالكترونية.   500 $ - كل المكافأت السابقة، إلى جانب عشاء مكون من المقبلات وطبق رئيسي والحلوى، والذي نقوم نحن بطبخه وتحضيره من أشهى المأكولات من المطبخ المتوسطي. كما ندعو واحد أو اثنين من الفنانين الذين عملنا معهم في السابق، فقط عليك أن تصل إلى عمّان أو رام الله، او يمكننا أن نلتقي في مكان آخر إذا كان أي منا مسافر إلى مكان آخر في العالم.
إن لم نتمكن من الوصول إلى الهدف من التمويل، أو الحد المطلوب، سوف نكتفي بالمبلغ المتوفّر فقط. سنكمل العمل، ولكن قد نضطر إلى تقليل عدد الفعاليات لتناسب المبلغ المتوفر. يمكنك المساعدة بوسائل أخرىإذا كنت لا تستطيع دعمنا مالياً، لا تفقد الأمل. نتمنى أن تساهم في نشر حملتنا قدر الإمكان، لذلك نرجو منكم مشاركة المعلومات والأخبار حول الحملة مع أصدقائكم ومعارفكم.لكم منا جزيل الشكر.

الصورة من الرحلة التي نظمناها أملاً في الوصول إلى ضفاف نهر الأردن في شهر تشرين الثاني من العام 2012.صورة الحملة لجسر اللنبي على الحدود الأردنية الفلسطينيّة من مكتبة الكونغرس الأميركي.

story:
Thank you for visiting our campaign! Crowd funding is a powerful option and by supporting through crowd funding you are becoming a part of a global, trending movement to put the power back in the hands of people.  You, the contributor, can say you not only support this, but you backed it, even if it's just a few dollars!  Read our mission, discover our perks, decide how much you can afford to donate and become a part of The Painted Pony™ forever!

 

 

REASONS WHY WE THINK YOU WILL WANT TO BACK OUR CAMPAIGN AND CONTRIBUTE TO HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN:

 

1.   Santa Fe, NM is largely known as the Art Mecca of the Southwest but surprisingly has only two art residency programs/options.  The Painted Pony™ can help fill that void.

2. You support small business that gives back:

 *Unique guest lodging that gives free residencies for writers/artists/photographers to further their creative goals and to produce enduring work

 *A small business that fundraises and donates to help get funding to youth art programs and to dedicate space and donations to Horse Rescue Shelters.

3. You really dig the artwork in our campaign.  (It's okay.  I'm fascinated by the work also! =)

4.  The idea of our 'stretch' goals is not only charitable, but very much needed.  These goals are reached when we surpass our initial goal here, or in the coming future once we have reached our campaign goal. 

5.  You believe that The Painted Pony™ is a unique idea (allowing guests to be a part of the artist movement, to join in on workshops, and to transform a simple guest stay/vacation into something a little more creative) and you want to see it succeed.

6. You've just discovered that for the price of a pack of gum, you can help build something.  You can collaborate with others in the simple support of a goal and make something very cool happen. That is a powerful concept.

 

 

              

 

 

 


Hi!


 We are Austin and Crystal and we are on an exciting mission to launch The Painted Pony™, a Bed and Breakfast/Hacienda coupled with an Artist In Residence Program, aimed at under-the-radar artists and writers from all over our nation to hold productive residencies at The Painted Pony™ in beautiful Santa Fe, New Mexico.  In exchange for your support, we have what we think are pretty great perks such as artwork by renowned Artist Theresa Paden, charitable contributions to phenomenal horse rescue groups, as well as vacation stays! We believe there is something for everyone!  

 

 

 

     What is The Painted Pony?
      The Painted Pony™ is our idea of the perfect hacienda/bed and breakfast combined beautifully with an Artist/Writer/Photographer Residency Program.  This existing Hacienda (currently operational under a different name) sits on many acres of quiet, rolling land in the eastern foothills adjoining Santa Fe's city limits.  With authentic adobe structures, dedicated guest hacienda, a private casita, inviting and colorful guest rooms, kiva fireplaces, and hiking trails, The Painted Pony™ is destined to become a B&B favorite!   There is also enough acreage to incorporate a horse rescue shelter, a goal that creates a safe and healthy environment for rescue horses, and offers the guests and artists who are in residence the opportunity to experience a horse ranch.  The Hacienda/Inn experience at The Painted Pony™ is all that it implies; a fusion of ART and culture, nature and beauty.  The B&B and the Artist Residency will co-exist, offering the guest an experience unmatched anywhere.  The Painted Pony™  will tie the hacienda/B&B experience to the Artist experience.  We will blend guest lodging with a gallery, and encourage nationally diverse artists
    to produce one of kind pieces to be appreciated here, in Santa Fe. 


                                                             

       

       

       

       

      Why we need your help:

       

       

      We have taken The Painted Pony/Artist In Residence Program as far as our resources and efforts will allow.  On our own, we have 1/3 of what we need to start.  We need your help to make up the difference and become operational!

       

       

      We need to produce enough capital to acquire the transitioning locale, to cover the costs of marketing and initial operating expenses, and to set in place the residency program itself; within Institutions, galleries, notable websites, and publications. The goal with this campaign is to help get us there, and get us open for mid-summer!  We need your help to make this happen!  The Painted Pony/Artist In Residence program operational costs, funding, and continued support thereafter will come from us, and from the operational budget of the B&B.  By flow funding from the B&B, the amount of residencies will increase each year, allowing for more concentrated programs, longer residencies, and collaborations for larger projects and larger teams. This keeps The Painted Pony Artist In Residence Program thriving, year after year! 

      Your help here, on our Indiegogo campaign, helps us get off the ground!

       

        Our goal:

      We need your help to allow us to: 

      • Take over operations of the existing hacienda and build out an additional, dedicated artist workshop. 

      • Fund the Artists, Writers and Photographers In Residence Program, with free room and board, amenities, and provide workshops for the artists and guests who wish to attend. 

      • Establish a network based referral and application system for artists and writers across the nation, through publications, website hosting and nominations through partnerships with galleries and art institutes.

      • Accept a minimum of 21 Residencies each and every year.

      • Provide art supplies, and create voluntary evening workshops for the guests who stay at The Painted Pony™ as a social, fun and engaging vacation experience.


        • Our Stretch Goals:  Should funding on our campaign surpass our goal, we can implement goals that are otherwise long-term or 2nd and 3rd year goals such as incorporating a horse rescue shelter on outlying acreage, to be maintained by a fully 501c non-profit organization, and accessible to our guests and our artists, building an additional Art Camp facility on site to offer annual summer art camps for children in the region, instructed by artists who have held residency with us. 
            Our goal is to be open for operation by mid-summer!


        WHAT AN "ARTIST IN RESIDENCE" PROGRAM ACCOMPLISHES:

         

        For the artist, a residency is opportunity. Artists, writers and photographers are invited to residencies or retreats to work, to create, to challenge themselves and to produce inspired work. It is a way for them to simultaneously disappear into seclusion, and awaken themselves to something new, fresh, and igniting. The city artist who comes to the Sangre de Christo mountains of Santa Fe leaves imprinted with the color of the city. The artist or writer from suburbia finds quiet stillness in the foothills and mountains, and is then inspired to infuse that emotion into their work. 


        These week or two week long stays are free to the artist, and often combine workshops, gatherings, and collaborations with other artists who are in residency as well. At The Painted Pony, artists and writers will be invited on an individual basis and group residencies. We will ask our artists to donate one piece of significant art, whether produced on-site or perhaps already in their collection, and those pieces will be auctioned off in fundraiser event annually to which ALL proceeds will fund youth art programs, specifically programs in need in the Santa Fe area. Art programs have  become the first to be cut in the ever-tightening budget belts of our schools. Support in the way of supplies and funding help keep them thriving and keep young generations exploring their creative potential.

         

        **Artist and Writer residencies are FREE to the artists/writers.  These are necessary programs that allow for creative reflection and production.  It is very much a respectful nod to the artist to say 'we appreciate what you give us, the imprint you leave on the world'.


         

         

         

        Why Santa Fe?

         

         

         In Santa Fe, Art fights only with Culture, and often the two are wrapped and wound so tightly together that it's impossible to tell them apart. It is the backbone of the City Different. It is what defines this community as unique; the festivals, the individuality, the sheer abundance of culture and art, and the craft of creating. There are over 200 museums and galleries in the city center alone.  Art IS Santa Fe. However, Artist in Residence programs are only found at the Institute or Art College, and for a city of such inspired and saturated art, it is surprisingly devoid of free residencies for Artist, Photographers, and Writers, especially ones that offer vacation style residencies.  What we offer to the artist who takes up residency is inspiration on a
        magnificent scale, time to create, a place to showcase their work, and an open door to networking possibilities they otherwise may not have.


         

         

        **For more information on our experience in the industry, relative facts and what makes us single-handedly the perfect combination to make this a success, please see our comments at the end and our ABOUT ME section!**

         Why Indiegogo?

         

        Collaborative fundraising for projects that we can support and get behind has huge implications.  This act of crowd funding changes the way ideas, innovations, businesses, art, projects and charities are managed; the backer becomes you, the contribution becomes applause for what you are doing, the project becomes reality instead of cool 'what if's' and the communities that benefit from these projects see an increase in awareness and functionality.  It's taking back our power to create.  It is filling a void where there is a need, or a desire.  It is having the ability to say 'I helped do this'.  Great ideas are born everyday and good collaborations get them accomplished.

         

        Ways you can help:

         

        In the spirit of collaboration, we have put together the following list of ways that you can help us achieve our goal!  When we reach our goal, it is because of YOUR support and share power! We have outlined our perks in detail and alternative ways that you can help support our campaign. Nothing is insignificant and any support is appreciated. If anything, Indiegogo is a testament to the idea that small acts of support can create big results.  So PLEASE BE SURE TO USE THOSE SHARE TOOLS!

         

        Follow us on Twitter @thepaintedpony7  and facebook  https://www.facebook.com/painted.pony.12


                       WE THINK OUR PERKS ARE TERRIFIC!  HOPE YOU AGREE!

         

        THE FOLLOWING IMAGES ARE ORIGINAL ART WORKS BY THERESA PADEN.  HER PHENOMENAL WORK IS AVAILABLE, THROUGH HER GRACIOUS SUPPORT, AS PERKS!  IN ADDITION, WE ARE OFFERING SIGNIFICANT VACATION STAYS AT THE PAINTED PONY IN SANTA FE.   PLEASE READ THE PERK DETAILS, BUT FIRST, ENJOY SCROLLING THROUGH CHOICES OF ART PRINTS 1-4!

         

        FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT ARTIST THERESA PADEN, PLEASE VISIT  WWW.THERESAPADEN.COM 

         

         

         **PLEASE NOTE A FEW OF OUR PERKS ARE FOR SIGNED ORIGINAL PAINTINGS BY THERESA PADEN!  THOSE ARE NOTED AS 'OPTIONS FOR ORIGINALS!'

         

         ***************************************************************************************

                                             CHECK OUT OUR PERKS!

         

         

        Many of our PERKS give 20% of your contribution to the following horse rescue shelters:

        California Coastal Horse Rescue in Ojai, CA.

        Walkin N Circles Ranch, Stanley, NM

         

         

         

        Just Having Fun    Charcoal by Theresa Paden 

         

         

         

         

         

        Running Free    Charcoal by Theresa Paden

         

         

        IPhone Case available in 4/4s, 5/5s.

         

         

         

         

         

         

        BUMPER STICKER:

         T-SHIRT:

        IN BLACK, SIZES ADULT SMALL-XXXLARGE

         

        ARTWORK 1-4       PRINT AND CANVAS PRINT OPTIONS:

         

         

         Out In Front  #1  

         

         
         

        Bison at Dusk #2

         

         

         

         

         


         Aurora #3


        Racing The Wind #4

         

         

         

        FOR ORIGINAL ART ON CANVAS PERKS:

         

        ORIGINAL PAINTING “SUNSET FROLIC”  24x24” Acrylic on 1.5" Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap

         

         

         

        ORIGINAL PAINTING “BISON ON THE SANTA FE TRAIL”  36X24”  Acrylic on 1.5" Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap

         

         

         

        ORIGINAL PAINTING “LONGHORN NAP TIME” 36X24” Acrylic on 1.5” Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap

         

         

         

         What happens if we do not meet our goal?

         

        First, no one wants to think about NOT funding completely.  However, contingency plans are in place and we have a well-thought out list of 'What-If's'.  Please read below:

         

        If we do not reach our funding goals, but have significant contributions, we will reach out for a private investor for the final push.  We hope that is not necessary as we want to keep the creative potential, and future goals in our hands.  A significant run here on Indiegogo is still a success, although it makes our goals a little more difficult to reach, we WILL reach them. 

         Contributors will receive all PERKS, as related to ARTWORK, TSHIRTS, BUMPER STICKERS, GRATITUDE, etc.  Those perks are guaranteed. The Vacation Stays are reliant on our ability to become operational.  Our contingency plans are in place for vacation stays if there is funding delays, or not enough funding here on Indiegogo, and we will offer you the alternative perks (t-shirts, art prints/canvas) if for any reason we do not meet our goal.

         

         

         

        FOR VACATION STAYS/ROOM NIGHT PERKS:

         

        If we fully fund, we will send you a formal voucher within 30 days of the end of this campaign to honor your rooms stays/vacation packages.  You will need to 'claim' your vacation stay once the voucher/invitation is received to show that you have received the perk.  Stays can be booked for anytime between October 1st and April 1st (unless otherwise noted in the perk) and are valid for 36 months to accommodate for availability.  This is fully contingent of funding and being operational by mid-summer.  If, for any reason, our operational opening is delayed, we will notify you immediately and work with you to make sure you get to book your stay when you need to!  Please book no later than 60 days before your desired stay.  Stays can only accommodate 2 guests. You will also receive with your voucher, a brochure, website link etc. for complete details on the B&B, rooms, pictures, amenities, etc.  It's a truly wonderful place.  I can't wait to see you all there!

         

        If we DO NOT fully fund, and your perk choice is a vacation stay or room nights at The Painted Pony™ we can offer you two choices:

        1.  Keep the voucher/perk and allow us an additional 45 days to put in place additional funding to become operational.  We still intend on making this a reality.  Hang on with us and we will honor your stay with graciousness!  You will still have to 'claim' the perk once the voucher/room stays are received, so that we can move forward, but we will give you the choice of taking the next option, at any time in lieu of the vacation stay.

        2. If we do not fully fund, anticipate any significant delays in additional funding, and you do not wish to hold your vacation stay, we will send you a custom art print (size 18x24, 24x36) of your choice of art (choices 1-4) as shown on this page, plus a Painted Pony t-shirt, and bumper sticker, and the iphone case. We will match the value of the perk to your contribution and make sure you receive comparable Perks!

        *(if your contribution is $500 or more, your print will come as a Gallery Wrapped Canvas print, ready to hang and in your choice of several sizes, up to 11x17.  We may have to make adjustments on size, depending on your choice of print to be sure the image from the original works appropriately. 

         

        NOTABLE COMMENTARY:

         

        T-SHIRT SIZING - ADULT SIZES SMALL THROUGH XXX LARGE.

        We have express permission to use the artwork on this campaign according to our descriptions.  Please note, these images are copyrighted by the artist and any use thereof is not permitted, including all images of artwork and our graphic for The Painted Pony™.

         

        Iphone cases come in the 4/4s and 5/5s model. 

         

         

         

        ABOUT US! 

        What makes us not only so dedicated to getting this off the ground, but also why we are the perfect pair to make this successful?  Austin has been in the hospitality industry for over eleven years.  In this time, and currently, he runs executive hotels, manages multi-million dollar property budgets, and has a truly phenomenal feel for the pulse of the hospitality industry.  Austin is a highly desired executive manager, has been named GM of The Year multiple times in his career and has the respect and admiration of high level executives in the Travel Industry based on his skill,  good sense of humor, and ability to understand the corporate bottom line without sacrificing the guests experience.  (He won't tell you any of this, but I will...I don't mind bragging on him! =) 

        As for myself, I compliment my husband with regard to business.  I have more of the artist in my character.  I'm a writer, and I endeavor in all of the arts (painting, mosaics, etc).  Creative marketing is my specialty and I ran a successful business of my own for five years.  I do, however, tend to describe myself as the creative, artistic 'Ying' to Austin's practical, business-minded 'Yang'. 

         

        Thank you for reading, for sharing, for posting, for contributing, for believing! 

         

        Crystal and Austin

        The Painted Pony™

We will ask our artists to donate one piece of significant art, whether produced on-site or perhaps already in their collection, and those pieces will be auctioned off in fundraiser event annually to which ALL proceeds will fund youth art programs, specifically programs in need in the Santa Fe area. Art programs have  become the first to be cut in the ever-tightening budget belts of our schools. Support in the way of supplies and funding help keep them thriving and keep young generations exploring their creative potential. **Artist and Writer residencies are FREE to the artists/writers.  These are necessary programs that allow for creative reflection and production.  It is very much a respectful nod to the artist to say 'we appreciate what you give us, the imprint you leave on the world'.    Why Santa Fe?   In Santa Fe, Art fights only with Culture, and often the two are wrapped and wound so tightly together that it's impossible to tell them apart. It is the backbone of the City Different. It is what defines this community as unique; the festivals, the individuality, the sheer abundance of culture and art, and the craft of creating. There are over 200 museums and galleries in the city center alone.  Art IS Santa Fe. However, Artist in Residence programs are only found at the Institute or Art College, and for a city of such inspired and saturated art, it is surprisingly devoid of free residencies for Artist, Photographers, and Writers, especially ones that offer vacation style residencies.  What we offer to the artist who takes up residency is inspiration on a magnificent scale, time to create, a place to showcase their work, and an open door to networking possibilities they otherwise may not have.  **For more information on our experience in the industry, relative facts and what makes us single-handedly the perfect combination to make this a success, please see our comments at the end and our ABOUT ME section!** Why Indiegogo? Collaborative fundraising for projects that we can support and get behind has huge implications.  This act of crowd funding changes the way ideas, innovations, businesses, art, projects and charities are managed; the backer becomes you, the contribution becomes applause for what you are doing, the project becomes reality instead of cool 'what if's' and the communities that benefit from these projects see an increase in awareness and functionality.  It's taking back our power to create.  It is filling a void where there is a need, or a desire.  It is having the ability to say 'I helped do this'.  Great ideas are born everyday and good collaborations get them accomplished.  Ways you can help: In the spirit of collaboration, we have put together the following list of ways that you can help us achieve our goal!  When we reach our goal, it is because of YOUR support and share power! We have outlined our perks in detail and alternative ways that you can help support our campaign. Nothing is insignificant and any support is appreciated. If anything, Indiegogo is a testament to the idea that small acts of support can create big results.  So PLEASE BE SURE TO USE THOSE SHARE TOOLS! Follow us on Twitter @thepaintedpony7  and facebook  https://www.facebook.com/painted.pony.12               WE THINK OUR PERKS ARE TERRIFIC!  HOPE YOU AGREE! THE FOLLOWING IMAGES ARE ORIGINAL ART WORKS BY THERESA PADEN.  HER PHENOMENAL WORK IS AVAILABLE, THROUGH HER GRACIOUS SUPPORT, AS PERKS!  IN ADDITION, WE ARE OFFERING SIGNIFICANT VACATION STAYS AT THE PAINTED PONY IN SANTA FE.   PLEASE READ THE PERK DETAILS, BUT FIRST, ENJOY SCROLLING THROUGH CHOICES OF ART PRINTS 1-4!  FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT ARTIST THERESA PADEN, PLEASE VISIT  WWW.THERESAPADEN.COM     **PLEASE NOTE A FEW OF OUR PERKS ARE FOR SIGNED ORIGINAL PAINTINGS BY THERESA PADEN!  THOSE ARE NOTED AS 'OPTIONS FOR ORIGINALS!'  ***************************************************************************************                                     CHECK OUT OUR PERKS!  Many of our PERKS give 20% of your contribution to the following horse rescue shelters:California Coastal Horse Rescue in Ojai, CA.Walkin N Circles Ranch, Stanley, NM   Just Having Fun    Charcoal by Theresa Paden   
 
 
 
 
Running Free    Charcoal by Theresa Paden  IPhone Case available in 4/4s, 5/5s.       BUMPER STICKER: T-SHIRT:IN BLACK, SIZES ADULT SMALL-XXXLARGE ARTWORK 1-4       PRINT AND CANVAS PRINT OPTIONS:   Out In Front  #1      Bison at Dusk #2      Aurora #3Racing The Wind #4   FOR ORIGINAL ART ON CANVAS PERKS: ORIGINAL PAINTING “SUNSET FROLIC”  24x24” Acrylic on 1.5" Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap   ORIGINAL PAINTING “BISON ON THE SANTA FE TRAIL”  36X24”  Acrylic on 1.5" Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap   ORIGINAL PAINTING “LONGHORN NAP TIME” 36X24” Acrylic on 1.5” Deep Canvas Gallery Wrap    What happens if we do not meet our goal? First, no one wants to think about NOT funding completely.  However, contingency plans are in place and we have a well-thought out list of 'What-If's'.  Please read below: If we do not reach our funding goals, but have significant contributions, we will reach out for a private investor for the final push.  We hope that is not necessary as we want to keep the creative potential, and future goals in our hands.  A significant run here on Indiegogo is still a success, although it makes our goals a little more difficult to reach, we WILL reach them.   Contributors will receive all PERKS, as related to ARTWORK, TSHIRTS, BUMPER STICKERS, GRATITUDE, etc.  Those perks are guaranteed. The Vacation Stays are reliant on our ability to become operational.  Our contingency plans are in place for vacation stays if there is funding delays, or not enough funding here on Indiegogo, and we will offer you the alternative perks (t-shirts, art prints/canvas) if for any reason we do not meet our goal.    FOR VACATION STAYS/ROOM NIGHT PERKS: If we fully fund, we will send you a formal voucher within 30 days of the end of this campaign to honor your rooms stays/vacation packages.  You will need to 'claim' your vacation stay once the voucher/invitation is received to show that you have received the perk.  Stays can be booked for anytime between October 1st and April 1st (unless otherwise noted in the perk) and are valid for 36 months to accommodate for availability.  This is fully contingent of funding and being operational by mid-summer.  If, for any reason, our operational opening is delayed, we will notify you immediately and work with you to make sure you get to book your stay when you need to!  Please book no later than 60 days before your desired stay.  Stays can only accommodate 2 guests. You will also receive with your voucher, a brochure, website link etc. for complete details on the B&B, rooms, pictures, amenities, etc.  It's a truly wonderful place.  I can't wait to see you all there! If we DO NOT fully fund, and your perk choice is a vacation stay or room nights at The Painted Pony™ we can offer you two choices:1.  Keep the voucher/perk and allow us an additional 45 days to put in place additional funding to become operational.  We still intend on making this a reality.  Hang on with us and we will honor your stay with graciousness!  You will still have to 'claim' the perk once the voucher/room stays are received, so that we can move forward, but we will give you the choice of taking the next option, at any time in lieu of the vacation stay.2. If we do not fully fund, anticipate any significant delays in additional funding, and you do not wish to hold your vacation stay, we will send you a custom art print (size 18x24, 24x36) of your choice of art (choices 1-4) as shown on this page, plus a Painted Pony t-shirt, and bumper sticker, and the iphone case. We will match the value of the perk to your contribution and make sure you receive comparable Perks!*(if your contribution is $500 or more, your print will come as a Gallery Wrapped Canvas print, ready to hang and in your choice of several sizes, up to 11x17.  We may have to make adjustments on size, depending on your choice of print to be sure the image from the original works appropriately.   NOTABLE COMMENTARY: T-SHIRT SIZING - ADULT SIZES SMALL THROUGH XXX LARGE.We have express permission to use the artwork on this campaign according to our descriptions.  Please note, these images are copyrighted by the artist and any use thereof is not permitted, including all images of artwork and our graphic for The Painted Pony™. Iphone cases come in the 4/4s and 5/5s model.     ABOUT US! What makes us not only so dedicated to getting this off the ground, but also why we are the perfect pair to make this successful?  Austin has been in the hospitality industry for over eleven years.  In this time, and currently, he runs executive hotels, manages multi-million dollar property budgets, and has a truly phenomenal feel for the pulse of the hospitality industry.  Austin is a highly desired executive manager, has been named GM of The Year multiple times in his career and has the respect and admiration of high level executives in the Travel Industry based on his skill,  good sense of humor, and ability to understand the corporate bottom line without sacrificing the guests experience.  (He won't tell you any of this, but I will...I don't mind bragging on him! =)  As for myself, I compliment my husband with regard to business.  I have more of the artist in my character.  I'm a writer, and I endeavor in all of the arts (painting, mosaics, etc).  Creative marketing is my specialty and I ran a successful business of my own for five years.  I do, however, tend to describe myself as the creative, artistic 'Ying' to Austin's practical, business-minded 'Yang'.   Thank you for reading, for sharing, for posting, for contributing, for believing!   Crystal and AustinThe Painted Pony™

story:
*THE LATEST AND THE FRESHEST UPDATE*

DECK COMPLETED! (well, almost... we are working on the internal structure!)

---

DECK in the making onsite at 116 Prinsep Street

If you've been around Prinsep Street for the past week, you might have noticed the transportation of DECK in bits and pieces from the depot to the site!

Let's cut to the chase! Here are a few images of DECK on site (completion is nearing and underway)

---

Fresh footage

Bringing you the freshest update of DECK offsite and onsite!

Offsite at the depot, DECK team + architects from LAUD + contractors are working everyday (weekends included!) to complete the fabrication of 19 containers. Fabrication = welding + cutting + painting + insulating + wiring + and so many more intricate processes that are often overlooked by the layman (us included)!!

Onsite at 116 Prinsep Street, contracters are laying the foundation for DECK. If you happen to be nearby, do pop by! The land is tucked in between NAFA and LASALLE. Watch the concrete slabs harden and the ground levelling happen in real time.

BITE-SIZE PROCESSES

116 Prinsep Street, Singapore 188665

At the depot (in the west)

19 containers in a fresh coat of paint

---

We are dreamers. And we are grounded with the drive to make dreams come true. Our next milestone in livening up Singapore’s photography landscape is within grasp. 


The people of DECK are ready to spearhead the development of un-used and urban pockets of land for the Arts! Support this epic endeavour to help raise DECK for 60 days, from August 1 to September 30. 


THE CONCEPT 

An accessible venue for people to celebrate photography right in the city centre of Singapore. 

(Artist impression by LAUD Architects)

DECK is an independent art space launched with the mission to support and nurture the community of photography enthusiasts in Singapore and Southeast Asia. 

It houses a Gallery, Resource library, Activity Studio, Artist’s Studio and Café within 19 magnificent re-purposed shipping containers, creatively assembled to overcome the challenge of land scarcity in our small city. 

The modular art space will act as an art connector between two art institutions, and offer an accessible venue for people to celebrate photography right in the city centre of Singapore. DECK welcomes the professional, the novice, the smartphone photographer, the photographed and the viewer to all come together, spend time, mingle and be inspired, with the belief that photography is about people after all. 


The Urban Space for the Arts 

Being a little island, Singapore does not have the luxury of having wide, open spaces. After sourcing for little pockets of spaces in the city for DECK, we struck gold! Berthed in the city centre of Singapore, it connects two art institutions LASALLE College of the Arts and Nanyang Academy of Fine Art, in the Bras Basah District, and creates an accessible space for people to celebrate photography.

Images taken from Google Map


THE STORY

DECK marks the coming of age of art photography in our region.

2902 Gallery began in 2008 with the belief that the market for art photography has to start somewhere for photo artists to make a living through their creation. It is a gallery with a mission to nurture and elevate the appreciation for art photography in Singapore and Southeast Asia. Through the years, the gallery actively took on more non-profit initiatives for photography. 

In the same year as the gallery opened, the inaugural Singapore International Photography Festival was launched, steadily expanding the biennale each year to reach out to more people in the community. At the same time, photography has become one of the easiest and most preferred forms of communication by anyone who owns a digital camera or smart phone. It is now one of the best mediums to get creative in our world. 

DECK by 2902 is established at a time like this. It marks the coming of age of art photography in our region, and is not merely a space for the arts but also a manifestation of the progress in the creation and appreciation of photography in Singapore, as well as an opportunity to bring our photography to greater heights.


YOUR SUPPORT

DECK is a non-commercial, independent arts venue for photography. As a ground-up arts initiative, DECK’s structure and land usage is not funded by any government agency and organisation. DECK can only happen when like-minded individuals share the vision of building a dedicated community space for photography. 

Play a part in building this groundbreaking arts space for the people; the public, the artists, the students, and the professionals in Singapore.

Total start-up cost of DECK: $350,000 

By helping us reach our goal of $200,000 on Indiegogo, it will cover:  

  • Construction and logistics costs: levelling of the piece of land on site, electrical wiring, adapting of containers for suitable use, etc. 
  • Fabrication costs: furnishing for specific functions 
  • Programming costs for 1 to 2 years 
  • Land lease for 2 years


    Our benefits for you are Perked-Up! 

    For your generous support, we are returning your kindness in cumulative forms! With every greater contribution you make to DECK, the more benefits you will receive from us. 

    For example, 

    A donation of  $70 will entitle you to a thank you card and message on DECK's website, a button badge, and a DECK tote bag. 

    A donation of $100 will entitle you to everything mentioned above, AND a free all-access Festival Pass to Singapore International Photography Festival 2014. 


    DECK's LIMITED EDITION merchandise 


    Designed by &Larry, DECK is giving away limited edition tote bags and A5-sized leather-bound notebooks for your contributions to DECK. (see perks' description)


    Make some noise for DECK!

    Support this epic endeavour by spreading the news about DECK

    While monetary contributions are very much appreciated, we love it when local (and international) arts-lovers are just as excited about DECK as we are! 

    • Share DECK's campaign using Indiegogo's share tools
    • Join and share DECK's FB event


    DECK is for the community, by the community. It can only happen with your active involvement. We appreciate every generous dollar you make and every supportive word you share about DECK. 

    A big thank you to everyone! See you at DECK in October 2014!


    If you would like to know what is happening at DECK on a regular basis, email us at meet@deck.sg

    For interest to collaborate or to host an event at DECK, email Ms Jay Lau at jay@deck.sg

    For corporate sponsorship beyond Indiegogo, please contact us directly at

    sponsor@deck.sg

(see perks' description)   Make some noise for DECK!Support this epic endeavour by spreading the news about DECKWhile monetary contributions are very much appreciated, we love it when local (and international) arts-lovers are just as excited about DECK as we are!  
Share DECK's campaign using Indiegogo's share tools
Join and share DECK's FB event


DECK is for the community, by the community. It can only happen with your active involvement. We appreciate every generous dollar you make and every supportive word you share about DECK. A big thank you to everyone! See you at DECK in October 2014!
If you would like to know what is happening at DECK on a regular basis, email us at meet@deck.sgFor interest to collaborate or to host an event at DECK, email Ms Jay Lau at jay@deck.sgFor corporate sponsorship beyond Indiegogo, please contact us directly at sponsor@deck.sg

story:
In Short:

One Thousand Words is an original book musical written by Michael Braud (LSU, class of 2014) and composed by Curran Latas (LSU, class of 2017).

Spanning the 1930's, 1940's and 1990's, One Thousand Words follows Warren and Daniel, two young men from the mining town of Winslow, as they try to navigate love and acceptance in times of conflict and intolerance.

Your Help Matters:

This indiegogo page has been created to help give One Thousand Words the premiere production it deserves.

Our $5,000 goal is in place to help us pay for our production space (The newly renovated Second Stage at Theatre Baton Rouge) and for our beautiful costumes, world-class sets, and magnificent orchestra.

The Impact

By supporting One Thousand Words, you are helping to bring a completely original musical to our community. This will be the first show of its kind since 2013, when our librettist, Michael Braud, presented his earlier work, The Seven, at Theatre Baton Rouge.

In addition, with your help, we hope that One Thousand Words will encourage and inspire a community-wide discussion on the struggles and issues facing the gay community, both in the early 20th century and today.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to financially contribute, here are some other ways that you can make our dream a reality!

Send out this link to all of your friends and family! Whether you use facebook, twitter, instagram, email or carrier pigeon, send this link to your friends and family and let them know how excited you are for the project! Ask them to help us out if they are able! Every little bit counts!

Donate Materials: Have some extra fabric lying around? Have some antiques or 1930's and 1940's costumes that you'd be willing to let us borrow? Have an old door that you're looking to get rid of? We'll take them off your hands! Just shoot us an email (1000words@gmail.com), and let us know what you have and when we can pick it up! Also, if you aren't sure what we're looking for, email us and we will send you an up-to-date list of what sorts of materials we currently need!

Donate your Time: Handy with a sewing machine or power tools? We will need some extra hands to help us construct our set and costumes, as well as hands to help us load-in and load-out of the theatre! Email us at 1000words@gmail.com if you're interested! (Also, we will be offering service hours to any local students who help us out!)

story:
Dear Friends,

I have been accepted for a residency beginning this month at the prestigious Vermont Studio Center.  Oh yes!  And I need your help to get there. 

The residency is  a great opportunity to develop my work, and to meet lots of other artists and writers.  Although I am receiving an artist's scholarship and work study grant to attend, I still have to pay a portion of the cost of my residency, a significant amount for me.  And that's where you come in!  

If you are able to contribute to help me get to the Vermont Studio Center, I have some fabulous prizes to offer you-- original artworks made by me.

Check out these unique perks:

For $25. you get a 9 by 12 inch unique pastel drawing.

For $50. you get a unique handheld painting, 6 x 1-1/2 x 3/4 inches, painted in oil on all 6 sides.

For $75. you get to join me for a one-on-one studio visit in my studio, and pick out a handheld painting or a pastel drawing of your choice.

For $100. you get a private studio visit, a pastel drawing AND a handheld painting of your choice.

And for $200 you get all of the above, plus a NEW work that I will create this fall at the Vermont Studio Center!

Please contribute to my campaign and help me go to the Vermont Studio Center residency.  Thank you!

Pastel Drawing (example)

Handheld Painting (example)

Studio Shot

Check out my website for more information about me and to see examples of my prior work:
http://www.jefffrederick.net

And if you can't contribute (and believe me, I understand), maybe you can share my campaign with someone who might like some original art?  It's easy to share an Indiegogo campaign.  Any attention you can help me get would be much appreciated!

Thank you for your support!
Jeff.

story:
What is it about?

  • We are a team of South African artists who wish to support the people of Troyeville in downtown Johannesburg to raise up “iThemba Tower”. This is a 30 meter-high permanent art installation made with over 5,000 recycled plastic bottles, on a redundant communication tower. The project will collect & register an equal amount of messages from the community and the contributors to this campaign, and each each of them will become a "message in a bottle". 

  • This project is about recycling and giving visibility to a less advantaged community in Johannesburg, by raising up a massive tower in which everyone participates. The bottles will be collected from the local informal waste collectors known in the streets of South Africa as ‘Zama Zamas’. The project will also get the local schools involved, contributing to raise awareness about recycling among kids in Troyeville. 

The idea

  • The installation will be placed in the community sculpture garden of the “Spaza art gallery”. This gallery garden has been in the neighborhood for over a decade and is a safe-haven for any type of creative talent in the community to be nurtured and displayed. 
  • The project will be overseen by street artist r1. who collaborated in a similar pilot project in 2013 called “The Tower of Isaac” . This project received a lot of international and local attention. The story featured on the radio, in South African newspapers and international art websites. 
  • The "Tower of Isaac” was a pilot project about how homeless people survive through recycling. The installation ended up exhibited in Troyeville. Troyeville community was so inspired when the bottles went up that they decided to continue with this idea, and cover an entire 30 meter-high communication tower with plastic bottles.

What We Need & What You Get
  • This project will need a minimum of $5,000  (about £ 3,000) to be fully realized. The funding will be used to: (1) buy hardware materials including 30 meters of wire mesh, (2) obtain over 5,000 recycled plastic  bottles from the informal Zama Zama collectors, (3) hiring a basket crane to install the bottles in the 30 meter-high communication tower, (4) printing materials for the promotion & dissemination of the campaign,  (5) advertising in social media and radio , (6) outreach, coordination and implementation expenses.
  •  To thank you all for donating and helping raise this amount of money, there are perks on the right hand side of the page.
  • If the target is not achieved - the project will be implemented partially. I.e. if half the funding is obtained, only a portion of the 30 meter-high tower will be covered with recycled bottles.
  • The final installation will take place in early 2015.

The Impact

  • iThemba means trust, hope. By contributing to this project you will support Troyeville community to to raise the "iThemba Tower ", a public art monument, a symbolic communication tower around which a diversity of people can share their collective hopes. 
  • The informal waste collectors Zama Zamas, work long hours and often live in the street.They get a meager compensation for their hard work. By supporting this project you will contribute to their livelihood. The project will also bring a new perspective on the bottles they collect every day. 
  • Raising awareness on recycling and the use of plastic through outreach activities involving local schools and community-based organizations.
  • This project will strengthen the community of down town Johannesburg.  The 30 meter-high installation will attract a lot attention, and become a landmark and symbol of inspiration. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute with funds but you have a business, you may want to contribute with wire mesh, hardware materials, printing services, etc. 

Community-based organizations are also much welcome to participate the activities of this project!  contact us!

All in-kind contributions will be acknowledged and will feature in our project.

BE A PART OF IT - HELP US RAISE THE  iTHEMBA TOWER!!
story_txt:
What is it about? 

We are a team of South African artists who wish to support the
people of Troyeville in downtown Johannesburg to raise up “iThemba Tower”. This is a 30 meter-high permanent art installation made with over 5,000 recycled plastic bottles, on a redundant communication tower. The project will collect & register an equal amount of messages from the community and the contributors to this campaign, and each each of them will become a "message in a bottle". 


This project is about recycling and giving visibility to a less advantaged community in Johannesburg, by raising up a massive tower in which everyone participates. The bottles will be collected from the local informal waste collectors
known in the streets of South Africa as ‘Zama Zamas’. The project will also get
the local schools involved, contributing to raise awareness about recycling among kids in Troyeville. 


  

The idea

The installation will be placed in the community sculpture garden of the “Spaza art gallery”. This gallery garden has been in the neighborhood for over a decade and is a safe-haven for any type of creative talent in the community to be nurtured and displayed. 
The project will be overseen by street artist r1. who collaborated in a similar pilot project in 2013 called “The Tower of Isaac” . This project received a lot of international and local attention. The story featured on the radio, in South African newspapers and international art websites. 
The "Tower of Isaac” was a pilot project about how homeless people survive through recycling. The installation ended up exhibited in Troyeville. Troyeville community was so inspired when the bottles went up that they decided to continue with this idea, and cover an entire 30 meter-high communication tower with plastic bottles.







What We Need & What You Get
 
This project will need a minimum of $5,000  (about £ 3,000) to be fully realized. The funding will be used to: (1) buy hardware materials including 30 meters of wire mesh, (2) obtain over 5,000 recycled plastic  bottles from the informal Zama Zama collectors, (3) hiring a basket crane to install the bottles in the 30 meter-high communication tower, (4) printing materials for the promotion & dissemination of the campaign,  (5) advertising in social media and radio , (6) outreach, coordination and implementation expenses.
 To thank you all for donating and helping raise this amount of money, there are perks on the right hand side of the page.
 If the target is not achieved - the project will be implemented partially. I.e. if half the funding is obtained, only a portion of the 30 meter-high tower will be covered with recycled bottles.
The final installation will take place in early 2015.




The Impact


iThemba means trust, hope. By contributing to this project you will support Troyeville community to to raise the "iThemba Tower ", a public art monument, a symbolic communication tower around which a diversity of people can share their collective hopes. 

The informal waste collectors Zama Zamas, work long hours and often live in the street.They get a meager compensation for their hard work. By supporting this project you will contribute to their livelihood. The project will also bring a new perspective on the bottles they collect every day. 
Raising awareness on recycling and the use of plastic through outreach activities involving local schools and community-based organizations.
This project will strengthen the community of down town Johannesburg.  The 30 meter-high installation will attract a lot attention, and become a landmark and symbol of inspiration.  
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you cannot contribute with funds but you have a business, you may want to contribute with wire mesh, hardware materials, printing services, etc. 
Community-based organizations are also much welcome to participate the activities of this project!  contact us!
All in-kind contributions will be acknowledged and will feature in our project.
BE A PART OF IT - HELP US RAISE THE  iTHEMBA TOWER!!

story:
"DO IT AGAIN"

Hello, Some of you may already know of the Grasshopper. If not you should keep an eye out for us on the playa. This will be her 9th year traveling to Black Rock City The last few years things have really started to show wear and tear.  So she finally got some much needed TLC this summer.  This year we will be much brighter than ever before with 6000 new LED's!  A big investment that really needed to happen. No more EL wire. We have also done a nice upgrade to the propane system. In the past we were only using small propane cylinders to make that big flame. Unfortunately it was very limiting as to how much we could burn. NOW... this year we have the capacity to carry 75+ gallons a night ! 

We're looking to raise $1500.00 to help out with the propane costs this year. This will be our first attempt ever to raise funds for the Grasshopper.  Typically we would be OK but this year between the LED's, new generator to power all those strip lights, and other odds and ends for the propane system, we could really use your help!

We have put $1500.00+ into her already between the generator, lights, and propane system.

75 gallons x (appx.) 3.00 gallon = 225.00 a night x 7 =$1575.00

If we don't reach our goal, we're going to do our best to provide as much heat as possible thats within our budget.

Theres something about providing that burst of fire to the people of the playa late at night. Sometimes you see us coming and sometimes we may just scare the hell out of you and drop you to the ground. 

We can't offer any perks other than a lot of propane being burned throughout the week. I'd be happy to provide a large blast of heat if we have the fuel on board to do so. 

Every dollar helps as well as letting people know about us.

THANK YOU!  We can't wait to hear you all yell "DO IT AGAIN" !
